Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest Marriott Hotels I Have Stayed At in PNW”
Reviews.Author: douger67
Reviews.Content: I got to be honest-this hotel is everything you would want in downtown Seattle-very nice rooms with balcony-nicely decorated-the people are very nice and will lead you in the right direction-short walk to the pier as well as fish market-decent restaurant across the street. I would echo that the walls are thin but not too bad. Valet Parking was a bit steep-maybe you can ask for a deal-no self park-it is about a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a "home base" for your Seattle Vacation”
Reviews.Author: RobotMathilda
Reviews.Content: I was a tourist in my own hometown a few weeks ago. Spend a weekend celebrating a birthday (Grandma's 95th) at the Marriott Waterfront Seattle. I have stayed in a couple other hotels in the city, but this was the most enjoyable. Aside from being a very comfortable and well staffed hotel at a reasonable price, the location of the Marriott Waterfront is ideal for a Seattle vacation. Staying here, we were afforded the quintissential view of the Sound and Olympic Mountains off our balcony. Watching the sun rise over the mountains as the ferry's rolled in and out across the Sound was a peaceful respite from a busy weekend. So peaceful, yet only a short three block stroll from Pike Place Market and the core Downtown area! This location is perfect. Starting our day walking through "The Market", with it's many bakeries and coffee shops was a perfect way to start our day as "tourists". From there, it's no more than a mile in any direction to access some of Seattle's must-see's. To the north, The Space Needle, Seattle Center, and Queen Anne Hill (don't forget to visit Kerry Park!). To the East, the retail core, museums, theaters, and Capitol Hill (home to some of the finest restaurants and people watching Seattle has to offer). To the South you'll find Seattle's oldest neighborhood, Pioneer Square and beyond that, SODO, where you can catch a soccer or baseball game and find some decent BBQ. Also, don't forget to stroll the Waterfront, which is right out the front door of the Marriott. Visit the Aquarium, Ivars (Seattle's most beloved fishhouse), and the multitude of quirky shops. The waterfront is a good way to spend an afternoon or a good starting point for one of the many boat tours you can enjoy. After a long day of touristing, the Marriott Waterfront is a great place to return to relax for the evening. It has all of the amenities you would expect: restaurants, gift shop, meeting rooms, swimming pool, and 24-hour gym.

Reviews.Title: “Not the usual Mariott quality”
Reviews.Author: Rohirrim_maiden
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a conference in April 2012. The room was spacious and very clean, but the walls were so thin, that I could hear the TV and the person talking next door. Hallway noise was very prevalent, sometimes it sounded as if someone was knocking on your door. The bed was very hard and there were only 2 fiber pillows, the rest were feather. There was the standard fridge and coffeemaker in the room, wished that there had been a microwave. If you are staying for an extended period, I highly recommend asking for a room with a view. My view, was a sliver of bay/ocean front and the side of a parking garage. Also, there is a train track that runs right behind the hotel, and you will hear it, 2-3 times a night. This hotel is within walking distance from many local attactions, but beware, it is all uphill and if you have mobility issues, it may be a bit daunting. The staff were polite and helpful, but I do wish that I stayed closer to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, good location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Cyclerich
Reviews.Content: Very clean and quiet. Had a great breakfast in the attached restaurant. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun mother daughter weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Erin D
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a fun mother-daughter weekend away! The room was lovely and so was the staff. We only stayed for two nights and were out of the room for most of that having fun in the beautiful city of Seattle but I would definitely recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Travelingilly
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is located right on the waterfront overlooking Elliott Bay. It's a short walk to many waterfront restaurants, the Space Needle and Pike Place. Great views of the Olympic Mountains on a clear day.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: Jackson J
Reviews.Content: The employees here are really nice an helpful! Rooms are spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for Seattle stay”
Reviews.Author: HearDoc
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this property and found the location to be perfect. Fantastic corner room view from room 447. Lot's of light in the room, balcony and bed was comfortable as expected. The hotel is just below the Pike Street Market, a block from the Seattle Aquarium and one block away from the cruise terminal. This would be a great place to stay pre/post cruise. Room rate was considerably less than comparable hotels in the area and a better location. I will certainly be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fine but not Great”
Reviews.Author: ReviewerD
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a standard Marriott. It's kind of a fun location but it's very touristy. For the price, I was expecting a lot more. If you do decide to stay here keep these things in mind: 1) Don't park your car there. It will cost a fortune. There are parking lots nearby that charge half as much. 2) Don't eat at the hotel restaurant. There are many wonderful places to eat in Seattle, this is not one of them. But there are some top-notch places within walking distance. 3) Do yourself a favor and get away from the waterfront for a few hours so you can see what Seattle is really like.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: ThorneloeFamily
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent 4 nights at the Marriott Waterfront last week. The Marriott Waterfront is in a lovely location right on Alaskan Way. Lots of sites to see on the waterfront, so we couldn't have asked for a better location. Pike Place was just a short 5 minute walk away. Our room was okay, but we did expect it to be a bit more luxurious due to the price we were paying $200++/night. Room and bathroom were spotless!! A+ to the housekeeping staff!! Beds were comfortable, but pillows were not. One complaint we had was our toilet. It was an automatic flushing toilet and the sensor was so sensitive, that it would flush any time we walked near the toilet. We asked the front desk to have a look into the problem. They sent their "engineer" up and the only solution they came up with was to leave the lid up and flush manually. We found this quite amusing. The blow dryer in the room is from the 1980's and needs to be upgraded ASAP, we found this totally unacceptable for a hotel of this caliber. The lobby is tastefully decorated and welcoming. Friendly bell & front desk staff!! A+ The Hook and Plow restaurant was okay, nothing incredible. I did find it strange that all the employees were wearing jeans though. Breakfast potatoes were not good....I didn't even eat them as they were so greasy. Now to the pool......it is absolutely horrible. Everything looks so dirty. The hot tub is small and needs to be replaced (maxium people it can hold is 4). I went into the pool area three days in a row, and the pool was not vacuumed once. Big piles of dirt in corner of pool. There is also lots of black stuff in the pool (I'm guessing mold on the walls). Floor tiles are dirty in the pool area. Basket with towels wasn't emptied for three days. There was some gum on a planter that wasn't removed for three days. I can't say enough how disgusting the pool area is. Definitely not up to Marriott's standards. As far as I am concerned, the pool needs to be shut down and renovated ASAP. I am very surprised that other reviewers have not mentioned the condition of the pool! Overall, I would stay again and would recommend the Marriott Waterfront to friends & family.

Reviews.Title: “Staycation Getaway”
Reviews.Author: skarriemonster
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a quick birthday/valentine overnight treat. When we got to our room, there was a note for my husband wishing him a happy birthday with chocolate covered strawberries and sparkling H20. I didn't ask for this - but when I called to request an early check-in and confirm the room type, they asked if we were celebrating anything. Nice touch! We stayed in a waterfront room, high floor, which has a front (vs. side) view out to the water and a balcony. This was great - but if it were cruise ship season, I wouldn't splurge for that as you would likely only see the side of the cruise ship. Bed was very comfortable, room spacious, with a nice sitting chair and a fairly large balcony. The weather was blustery so we didn't sit out there but it was wonderful to see the ferries come and go. The floor was high enough that you could leave the drapes open and no one from the street level could see you. (this would NOT be the case if the cruise ship were in port and were at floor level). Property common areas were very clean, polished, and staff was friendly. We also easily got a late checkout. We will go back and/or recommend the hotel for visitors to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Waterfront hotel - view of the parkade”
Reviews.Author: DonandLar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Waterfront this week while attending a conference at the nearby Bell Harbor Conference Center. The location of the hotel is great; very close to the conference center and just a 5-7 minute walk to Pike Place Market, downtown shopping and restaurants, and the monorail. While the hotel is on the waterfront, which is very nice, my room faced the parkade. Because of the set up of the hotel, I don't think that many rooms have a good view. In this day of being connected, I was stunned to find out that the rooms did not have WiFi. It is only possible to connect with an ethernet cable. There is free WiFi in the lobby, but it is "spotty." The room was clean and basic.

Reviews.Title: “In need of an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: ZMR
Reviews.Content: Good location to explore Seattle from. But the hotel is in need of a refurb. Rooms were tired, bathrooms basic and hardly any amenities. No wifi in room so beware. Not worth the price

Reviews.Title: “Updated Marriott on the Water”
Reviews.Author: pikapptcu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night while staying in town for the weekend. Pretty good location. Short walk to the Pike's Place Market area. Great sunset views right on the water. I was upgraded to a corner room on fourth floor with an excellent view. Rooms have been nicely renovated. Only downside is the lack of restaurants/bars close by. They do have the Hook & Plow on site, but it was dead. Ended up going back towards Pike's Place Market and grabbing a quick bite before hitting up Fox Sports Grill for the PPV UFC fight that night. Just be warned if you are walking back late at night, elevator shuts down at 11pm and there are some homeless people milling about.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Roluke
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business but was surprised of how nice this hotel is. It is located across the street from the water. It looks like most rooms have views of the water. It is great seeing ferries come and go. It also is in a great location. Close to everything such as restaurants and Pike's Market. Starbucks is right across the driveway which is very convenient in the morning! The room was very comfortable and lives up to the Marriott standard. The bed was comfortable and the room was very clean. The staff was so friendly and helpful. I would easily recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Mrugesh P
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a night before hopping on to the cruise to Alaska. A beautiful hotel located just minutes from pike market and all the downtown hangouts.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Felipe70
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here for business several times and have enjoyed my stay each time. It's right on the water front, very close to the Pike's Market and many local restaurants. I recommend going to nearby restaurants before considering the one at the hotel. This is based solely on value and quality of preparation for the money. On the room front the rooms are quiet, wonderfully comfortable, especially the bed. No microwave or refrigerator. However they've recently installed a light timer (motion detector) for the bathroom which I support for ecological reasons. But the timer is short and you're left in the dark shortly after starting your shower (shake the curtain). Other than that the staff, rooms and amenities are flawless. If you're a Marriott gold member the concierge's room offers a hot breakfast as well as the usual cereals, pastries and fruit.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with beautifully renovated lobby!”
Reviews.Author: ksofka
Reviews.Content: This Marriott hotel is one of most visually arresting in which I've stayed. As per usual, the staff was wonderful, professional; the restaurant (which will soon also be remodeled) very serene with excellent wait staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short stay.”
Reviews.Author: Jim F
Reviews.Content: My wife, son and i stayed at this hotel in january 2012 for 3 nights, and we had a nice stay. The young man who carried our bags to our room seemed genuine in the interest he took in us. He recommended a few attractions to visit and a restaurant called Aqua, all of which we visited and enjoyed. This was very handy seing we are Australian and our stay was short. The hotel was very nice, the location was quiet and close to pikes place market. The view from our room was just ok, the better view room's only have one bed we were told. The bar and hotel restaurant were very nice, and service in the consierge room (especially from the man working nights) was first class. A good 4 star hotel. i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Newly remodeled and within walking distance to city center”
Reviews.Author: DawnFromIndiana
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while visiting my son who is in the Navy. He was able to get a few days off to stay with me which is why I chose to stay in the city. Marriott recently updated this hotel and my room was beautiful, clean, and comfortable. I only had a partial view of the water but it was nice. The comfort made up for it. Their food is wonderful---get the eggs benedict! They have a nice shop with snacks and breakfast items. You are within walking distance to the downtown shopping and the pier. Be sure to ask them how to get to the city elevator so you don't have to do so much uphill walking.....you will get enough of that anyway. What made it nice for me is that I was only a 10 to 15 minute walk from the ferry.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: Loves2TravelALOT_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here once before and liked the place.This time we ended up in an ocean front room with unobstructed views... who cares if it rained? We had such a fabulous view we didn't want to leave the place. Watched the ferries going back and forth. The service was excellent and the entire stay was very relaxing. I forgot my curling iron and contacted the hotel who immediately responded and sent it back to me. Once I forgot something at the Hilton Seattle but they weren't as accomodating. As a Marriott Rewards and Hilton Honors high ranked member who does have a choice where to stay, this will be our place in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Marriott in a great location”
Reviews.Author: CHCG-JEK
Reviews.Content: Beautiful views, spotless room, friendly service, and overall great value. The hotel is located next to the elevator that takes you up a nice stroll over to Pike Street Market.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Scope816
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days in early December. The location is right across the street from the waterfront with a great view of Puget Sound if you have a water view room. Very comfortable, clean room. You can explore most of downtown Seattle from this location if you don't mind walking. We like to walk so it was perfect for us. There is a public elevator right next to the hotel that takes some of the hike out of getting to the Public Market. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. We did all 5 days in Seattle without a car from this hotel. Take the train fron SeaTac to the end of the line in Seattle and then grab a taxi from there to the hotel. It is just as fast as a taxi and costs $10 for 2 people instead of $40. Be sure to check out the happy hour deals in the hotel bar. They have some good beers and tasty snacks at great prices.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, beatiful view”
Reviews.Author: teridacktyl
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a King water view room. Watched the ferries come in and out wile relaxing on the most comfortable bed. Although I faced Alaskan Way it was still very quite. The staff was helpful and friendly. The only downside is that there was no wi-fi only wired internet Would definitely stay. again, either fro business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: sandra541613
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed one weekend night to attend "Cinderella" at the Fifth Avenue. The hotel is beautifully maintained; lovely artwork and furnishings in the lobby. The entire staff is professional, helpful, and friendly. Loved the rooms. Very, very, comfortable beds and tastefully furnished. Next door is an outdoor elevator that takes you up the hill to Pike Place market. Walking distance to all the waterfront shops and Westlake center. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Service please?”
Reviews.Author: GChert
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 10pm from the east coast and there was no one at the front desk.....for 10 minutes! I had to go find someone. Next morning they forgot to deliver breakfast until I called twice to remind them they were 30 minutes late. Room was very average and you had to walk forever to get there. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful housekeeping staff”
Reviews.Author: RLRaceGirl
Reviews.Content: This is my second time at this hotel, and the location is perfect for discovering Pike's Market and Downtown Seattle. A little further walk to Pioneer Square, but, with the new Metro system, getting around Seattle has become very easy. The housekeeping staff at this hotel has always been the most memorable. They understand very quickly what your schedule is, so they are able to clean the room, tidy up and you are never interrupted by a knock on the door of "when can I clean your room". The staff is friendly, willing to help and has lots of suggestions for things to do. My only issue is the concierge lounge that closes on Friday morning and does not open again until Sunday night. For those weekend stays, it means that those ammenities are not available. Fortunately, the concierge staff warned us, so we stocked up with water and sodas for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Best Loacation to Explore Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Surfnorthwest
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of days to visit friends and see a concert at Key Arena. The location is perfect for a base camp to explore Seattle. I loved the elevator that took you up six floors to the Pikes Place Market, took use maybe 10 minutes to get there. Lot of good places to eat nearby. Parking is a bit much here but it really isn't any cheaper anywhere else. Check in was smooth and professional. Thought the rooms were clean, bed was comfortable but the rooms are on the small side, not a big deal. Wifi signal is strong and free There is a small bar in the lobby and the bartender made good drinks, when I pay $7-8 for a drink it at least better be a good drink and they were. Nice gift shop with moring coffee and rolls, Starbucks is right outside the main entrance if you want that. I think kids would like this place as it is very close to the aquarium and has a indoor/outdoor heated pool. Not much to fault with this one, again the location for any music event, sporting event, shopping or sight seeing is a great place. Cheap alternitives closer to the airport for sure but if you want downtown this is a safe bet.

Reviews.Title: “Where's the service and quality control?”
Reviews.Author: cervezaguy12
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is plain poor. Very poor check in service. Small rooms. Bad odors and worst. No one at the bar for 25 minutes when the bar was supposedly open. Stay away would be my recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Proximity, Wonderful Puget Sound Views”
Reviews.Author: go-dawgs-go
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our 22nd wedding anniversary. We paid for an upgrade to our room, which gave us a wonderful view of Puget Sound. The hotel is right across the street from the cruise ship terminal, but there wasn't a ship in port. That undoubtedly would have obstruced our view, but instead we were able to see some nice yachts docked. There is a nice walkway to the waterfront shops, and even better, there's an elevator outside the building, which takes you close to the Pike Street Market. We had breakfast in the restaurant downstairs, and it was wonderful. The service was fantastic. They have a breakfast buffet, but we ordered a three egg omlet. Keith's had crab and goat cheese. He loved it! We will definitely stay here again. We were commenting that it would be the perfect hotel for a girls getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Trains!”
Reviews.Author: Corgipilot
Reviews.Content: The rooms on the north east corners are just above the railroad tracks. Room 419 was miserable because of the noise. The location of the hotel is great for the Bell Harbor convention center and the Pike place Market but do be aware of what room you are in!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel located in a very good area”
Reviews.Author: dewsita
Reviews.Content: I went for a conference and I stayed in the Marriott Waterfront. It is a very good hotel with clean and comfortable rooms. Wifi is available inside the hotel. The staff is very friendly as well. The food was very good with a lot of variety. You can walk easily to Pike Place Market,the Sculpture park and along the waterfront. There are several restaurants and the aquarium is in this area as well.I had a great time here.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location (and a killer view too)”
Reviews.Author: buffaloali
Reviews.Content: Went for business, and except for the ridiculously slow room service, it was great. Everyone was friendly. There is a computer and printer in the lobby for boarding passes. If you are carless and looking for great home base for a weekend trip - so close to Pike's Place and the sculpture park. Nice walking/jogging by the water.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is only good”
Reviews.Author: annHWashington_Dc
Reviews.Content: Typical Marriott with a very good location. Rooms are small - not sure why they even bother with a balcony. Our room was never made up before 4pm - most annoying after a day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Practical hotel for business trips with great views”
Reviews.Author: Roadwarrior1000
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Waterfront is located on Alaskan Way near the cruise terminal. It's location is a few minutes away from the downtown area. Clean, comfortable, the hotel has friendly and helpful staff. They are knowledgable about the city and the area and the doormen are good at getting taxis quickly. The concierge lounge is up to standard with a decent selection for breakfast, and snacks in the evening. Only downside is the hotel really has only one restaurant and a limited menu. However breaksfast is okay. There is a reasonable fish restaurant across the road called Antony's, which atleast gives you some choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kelly M
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. It's pretty expensive but the view (if you get waterfront) and how close it is to great attractions makes it worth it. It's within easy walking distance to Pike Place Market, the waterfront, Seattle Aquarium, etc. You do have to pay $35 each time you want your car it which is quite a pain. There is a restaurant that's pretty good and also a little cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Just needs a few more touches....”
Reviews.Author: memt77
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel and the staff is helpful. The view of the busy working waterfront is good fun -- our room was right out front and up high. It's an above-average Marriott. I liked the empty refrigerator (rather than stocked mini-bar), especially given its location near the Pike Market -- lots of cheese, smoked salmon and lovely wines available to grace the fridge. Two small items: when you pay more than $250/night for a hotel room, there really ought to be more than two medium-sized towels for showering. I'm all for ensuring that water isn't wasted washing towels unnecessarily; but it also means that with two people sharing a room, it's just not enough. Second, on the first day of our visit, we left the hotel at 9 a.m., walking past dirty room service dishes in the hallway. Still there upon our return at 4 p.m., and again when we left for dinner at 6 p.m. Unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Want2travel8082
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice & clean hotel. We had a partial view room view which meant that you had to stand at the window an look towards the water, otherwise you couldn't see the view. Liked the decor and large counter in the bathroom. The bed was comfortable and liked their pillows. Parking was expensive, they offer valet for $40.00, their website said self parking available for $21.00, when inquiring about self park they didn't offer any information and just told us that we could find our own parking nearby. I thought it was over priced for the location and no view, next time will stay at the Four Seasons or W.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent View of Waterfront”
Reviews.Author: rsfred
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a large corner room on 4th floor with floor-to-ceiling glass on two sides- small balcony (w/o furniture) facing water with terrific views-it was fun to watch cruise ship coming in the next morning-dock is less than a block from this hotel-walked across the street to Anthony's Fish Bar and ate outside. Easy walking from here to many sites. Ferries leave from nearby dock. They're coming and going quite often and enjoyed watching them. We now qualify for concierge lounge and it was well-stocked afternoon/evening/breakfast.This property is not a new, glitzy Marriott but the location is terrific, especially if you can get waterfront room.

Reviews.Title: “So disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Frenchie29
Reviews.Content: I had booked a room with Elliott Bay view (not a full watefront view room). What a disappointment. I actually had a view on the elevator that takes you up from the waterfront to Western Avenue and Pike Place Market. Oh, yes, I could see the water and the harbour but only if I stood at the window and looked to the right, not when I sat in the chair or on the bed. Nowhere during the online reservation process was I informed that what I might get is a very partial bay view, so I consider that the total price I had to pay for a room with a view on condos with a little bit of water at the far end was extremely high, as was valet parking. Other than that, checking in was efficient and came with a smile, the hotel is well located and furnished, the rooms are a good size with good amenities but the (oldish) bathtub was very slippery (I don't like using an old and dirty looking bath mat). Though I switched the A/C off, there was still a background noise all night. Talking about noise at night, be aware that very long freight trains run behind the hotel, honking away... In short, I was very glad I had some ear plugs. Dining at the 2100 Bistro was strange: though there weren't many people in the restaurant we were told that they were extremely busy and had to wait a long time for our drinks and then for our food, which when it finally came, was good. Breakfast is a good selection for every taste, including healthy options. All in all, not a bad address but I hate being misinformed about what room I will get and have to pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Book here if you can!”
Reviews.Author: Atlanta10
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel, right on the waterfront and within walking distance of all the major attractions. Our room was a corner room with a small balcony and 90 degree view of the harbor. Our friend stayed in a harbor front room and though smaller, had the same open wide expansive view. The beds were comfortable and rooms were spacious. The location couldn't be beat as great restaurants and Pike Street Market were within walking distance. The outside elevator to the upper street level facilitated access to Pike Street. Room service breakfast was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MPMG8r
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Waterfront Seattle really exceeded my expectations and will be my hotel of choice on all of my future, annual trips to Seattle. First, it has a great location right on the waterfront. It's within a block of the Aquarium and Bell Harbor Conference center, and a couple of blocks of the Pike St. Market. My room had a very small balcony with a view of the water, and it was fabulous to open the door and get the fresh air. The hotel is very clean with a sharp decor. The front desk was courteous and I was checked into my room in under 2 minutes even though I arrived several hours earlier than normal check-in time. I had a 2 double bed room which was quite spacious. The beds were very comfortable - not too soft or too hard - with good, although small, down pillows. The desk and task chair were perfect. Everything was clean and fresh. The thermostat and air conditioner worked great and were reasonably quite. The sound proofing is really good - I rarely heard anything outside my room. The bathroom is a little tight - I don't think you could have two people trying to get ready in it at the same time. I love the curved shower rods to make the shower feel more spacious. The hotel provides a rubber mat for the shower - make sure you use it because the tub is super slick. Water was reasonably soft and the temperature consistent. The hotel has free wireless, although it is *slow*. The wired internet is blazing fast and supposedly costs $13/day - but it didn't show up on my bill because it was included in my group rate. The room included a small refrigerator and a huge flat screen tv. My favorite feature, which I've never seen in a hotel before, was an adapter so you could watch your computer through the TV. They provide the VGA and audio cord and once connected, the TV automatically adjusted its settings to display the computer perfectly. One evening I watched a Redbox movie through the computer and another evening I watched HBOGo. This is a great, great feature - thank you Marriott! The adapter also has inputs for HDMI and RGA plugs. The closet was spacious with new wood hangers. The ironing board and iron were both new. The gym was clean, well lit, and well equipped with 4 treadmills, 2 recumbent bikes, and 2 elliptical machines - all of which were reasonably new, in good order, and had individual TVs. There were new, rubber dumbbells up to 50 lbs and two benches that can be inclined. Towels, water, and inexpensive headphones were free. One of the best gyms I've seen for a hotel. I did not bring a bathing suit this trip but will on future ones. The pool was large for a hotel and was neatly designed to be half indoors and half outdoors. There was also a hot tub that was calling my name after hiking through Seattle for a few hours. When I woke up on my last day my receipt was waiting for me in the room. You can check out through the TV or call the front desk. You can also ask the front desk to email you a copy of the bill - nice feature for the business traveler. Check out time is a generous 12 PM. Overall a fantastic stay with no complaints and a great value for the money. Great job Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: holidaytime96
Reviews.Content: Got an amazing sea front, corner room. Floor to ceiling glass overlooking the Seattle waterfront. Gorgeous! The room luxurious and the hotel restaurant and cocktail bar were great. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sjs9807
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay at prior to a cruise out of Seattle. It's right on the waterfront and just a short walk to the embarkation dock. We stayed there in May prior to our Alaskan Cruise on Norwegian. Super nice hotel and rooms are clean and nice. The front desk staff were very quick with the check in process as was valet with parking our car and helping us with some directions. Great staff. They have a little cafe near the front desk that also carries essentials you may have forgotton to pack. They also have a restaurant on the ground floor with great views of the waterfront. Pike Place Market is within walking distance but you have to climb a steep street to get to the market. Their rates are comparable to other hotels in the area, just book early and you should be able to get a decent rate. You do have to pay for parking if you drive. Nice place to stay on the water while you're in Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: hmgoldilocks
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in downtown Seattle. The hotel is great, large rooms, clean and with friendly/helpful staff. You couldn't ask for a better location on the waterfront. My only complaint is that parking is valet only and was very expensive at $39. Would definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ggtirevite
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Seattle's Waterfront Marriott for two nights in early September. It is located on the waterfront (obviously) and also just below the Pike Market. The person at the reception was extremely attentive, giving restaurant suggestions and offering to make reservations. We didn't use the restaurant, nor the rest of the facilities. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, solid business hotel”
Reviews.Author: bsoma
Reviews.Content: I was just there for a quick business trip. The staff was every efficient and positive. They handled many requests promptly. The location is great - right on the waterfront, walking distance to Pike's Market. Parking is $35 but they always had the car ready ahead of me. Rooms are well appointed, good internet access, room service. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, great location, great food”
Reviews.Author: mrplatinumtraveler
Reviews.Content: Our family of eight received an exceptional welcome, and immediately felt at home. The harbor views were relaxing, and we could walk to several great seafood restaurants on the waterfront. We cruised with Holland America, and the hotel was worth the additional transportation to Holland's pier.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel/Great Location”
Reviews.Author: edsatty
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the Marriott Waterfront hotel in Seattle (two adults, one 16 year old daughter). First time there. As Marriott Platinum members, we were upgraded to a junior suite, so cannot comment on regular rooms, plus we stayed there for points. Our junior suite was wonderful - very updated/modern, with two large flat screen TV's (one in the enclosed master bedroom and one out in the sitting/living area). The location was wonderful. Right across the street from waterway where cruise ships dock, elevator right outside that takes you up to the street level that has Pike Street Market, plenty of nice walking trails along the waterfront, near transit, restaurants, shopping, etc. Easy walk to Pike market each morning for breakfast, coffee, etc. Pool on 2nd level is indoor and kind of small, but there is a very pleasant outdoor sitting area adjacent to it with padded lounges/chairs. The staff was very pleasant in terms of giving recommendations, directions, etc. Hotel has a nice concierge lounge (not open on weekends). Would definitely recommend this hotel and plan to stay there again next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel - fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: rtwtraveller10
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is fantastic - as usual Marriott satisfy my needs - comfortable & clean rooms - The first impact when you enter the lobby is absolutebly impressive - I loved all the colours and the overall impact - they did a good job. They do have in/outdoor pool that i did not use - breakfast at the 2100 bistro is good. Yes, surely will recommend - you have great view of the bay from the room Close to the Market and almost everything

Reviews.Title: “Great location with good size rooms”
Reviews.Author: DrZeek
Reviews.Content: Great location to downtown with easy access to free bus #99. Rooms are a good size. Work out room has everything you need. Hotel restaurant is not worth the money nor is the service all that great. Our group rate was $209.

Reviews.Title: “For what it was, it was pretty good.”
Reviews.Author: TrentP1
Reviews.Content: Since being a Marriot gold member, the view from our room was quite nice. We had a view of the harbour, and it was quiet. I am not sure if there were rooms behind us, as the highway is behind the hotel, and I think that would be quite loud. For restaurants, you will have to leave the hotel to find a good one. There is a elavator a block away from the hotel that can take you to pike place market. From there is plenty of choices for food. the pool is small, so if you are into swimming lengths, it may not work.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: C B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights before leaving on a Celebrity Alaska cruise. Did not know when booked the location but it is right across street from Pier 66 cruise ship terminal. The bellman just loaded our luggage on luggage cart and walked us across the street to check-in. Great! Also, it was a great location for walking all along harbor area for sights and restaurants and for Pikes Market. There is an elevator alongside hotel that takes you right up within a block of the market.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in a very convenioent location”
Reviews.Author: Bob_plus_Four
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights before heading to Vancouver for a cruise. Super location right on the waterfront with a very easy walk to Pike Place Market, the Aquarium and ferries. Good room for four of us. The hotel only has rooms on three sides since the train tracks and the hill are immediately behind it. We were on the south side of the hotel and could see both Elliot Bay and the tracks so we had some train noise. If staying again I would request a room on the water side of the building. The concierge was extremely helpful and very well connected across the city, able to negotiate reservations for restaurants and attractions. Public transport was not near the hotel but taxis were plentiful. This would be a great place to stay before or after a cruise out of Seattle - the NCL ship was across the street.

Reviews.Title: “What A View!”
Reviews.Author: HendersonMimi
Reviews.Content: This weekend my husband & I spent a few days in Seattle & surrounding area. Stayed at 3 different hotels & the 2nd night, stayed at the Marriott Waterfront. It is fabulous but the downtown area is not for the faint of heart if you are the least bit of a timid driver. We stayed on a Friday night using Marriott Reward Points. Then for $50, upgraded to the waterfront side. When we walked into our room, we nearly fell over. This was not only waterfront, it was a corner room with walls on 2 sides of windows, each with its own balcony! The view was so beautiful, we didn't even turn on the TV until late that evening to catch the news. Next morning we treated ourselves with breakfast in our room. Everything was just as we ordered. Let me say that it even though we used points for the room stay, the other ameneties are regular big city resort prices. The service was very good and the hotel ameneties were quite lovely. It does, however, pay to ask for those little extras. Often, if not the majority of the time, you will get something good.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Partial Water View!”
Reviews.Author: Brian_NVA
Reviews.Content: Hotel seems new, or newly renovated. Lobby has a modern feel to it, and rooms are pleasantly decorated, although pretty standard Marriott stuff. Huge flat screen TV. Reading lights on headboard for beds. In room coffee maker (single cups). Armchair for watching TV or reading. One word of caution: Since this hotel is right on Elliott Bay, I asked at check-in if I could have a room with a water view. The front desk clerk said I could have a nice, corner room with a "partial" water view (#614). The reality is you really have to stretch to see the water, and there isn't a normal seating arrangement in the room that allows boat watching. You do, however, have an uncomfortably good view into other sleeping rooms (if that's your thing), since the room was on an inside corner. Generally it just meant I spent most of the time with at least the sheer curtains closed. The rooms have small balconies, but no one used them when I was there - too close together for comfort. I can't say enough good things about housekeeping. Julie was very accommodating, pleasant, went out of her way to make sure I was happy. She was almost reason enough to stay here again when I return to Seattle. Room service for dinner was a bit spotty. I liked the baked halibut the first night. Service was a little unpredictable - I wondered if this had been a problem for them since the "At Your Service" folks always called to verify that I had gotten my food (sometimes before the food arrived) and that everything was OK. It's a pretty limited room service menu... not a lot to choose from. Hotel is in a decent location. Right across Alaskan Way from Elliott Bay. About .2 miles from Pike Place Market (although all up hill). Not far from the Aquarium. I wouldn't mind staying here again - overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: dhoag123
Reviews.Content: We paid $384 for a one-night stay. It wasn't worth it. The hotel is beautiful... the location is ideal - near Pile's Market with beautiful views of Puget Sound.... BUT, the service is very poor. It took us 1/2 hour to get checked in. The front desk staff are very slow and don't seem properly trained. We were promised a roll-away bed and didn't get it. We'll try a different hotel next time we're in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “The best for a cruise”
Reviews.Author: rosey1946
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night before a cruise. The hotel is so well located. We had what they called a partial waterview and what I call a great water view. Got up the morning of the cruise and there was my ship, the NCL Star right in front of me. The room was perfect-clean, well decorated. We didn't eat at the hotel, but the check in was friendly and fast. The morning of the cruise, we called a bellman and he took our luggage across the street to the pier and checked it in for us. I'd stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Pike Market”
Reviews.Author: libintheburbs
Reviews.Content: This is a nice clean hotel which is nicely located between the waterfront and Pike Market. You can easily walk to the market, downtown, or the waterfront. The rooms are clean, up to date and most have a nice view of the water. The only downsides to the hotel are no free wifi, the restaurant is pricey, and the front desk staff is not terribly helpful. If you want some exercise there is a nice bike/run path in front of the hotel, or the exercise room has nice amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Kudos to Margot at the concierge desk!”
Reviews.Author: beachbobe
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Seattle for a short vacation and Margot provided us with expert advice as well as helping out with several reservations to dinners and events. You know right away you are working with a professional when you step up to meet with her. Can't thank her enough for the help!!

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: escrabajo
Reviews.Content: people working there mada things easy, but they are almost inflexible with check in / out schedules.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: MauiBear
Reviews.Content: I am a real Marriott fan and I have stayed at this hotel several times before without incident but this time was a disaster. There were dirty room service dishes (not mine) in the hallway for days, even after I complained several time. My room was not serviced ("The housekeeper for this room is new and must have forgotten" was the response I got). My car was not brought up when I called the valet (he said no one "told him" to bring it up). And when I asked the front desk attendant for the name of the GM, he said he didn't know who the GM was. Really??? You don't know your boss' name? Although they were ALL very apologetic, this was just a service nightmare. In all fairness, I have written the GM but have not heard back yet as it is too soon. But there were just too many problems and I expect more from a Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “A big, faceless property”
Reviews.Author: kbockl
Reviews.Content: Lovely lobby but dark basement-level meeting spaces, lovely rooms (quiet with comfortable beds). Service was friendly but not overly enthusiastic. (no one was going out of their way r moving too fast, although issues were eventually resolved. Maybe that's the laid-back Seattle culture?) The business center had outdated software and the two terminals were so close together it was difficult for two people to access them simultaneously. Free copying was a plus. I was here because this is where my company booked our meeting, but I'd select another location if I were to travel back to Seattle on my own dime.

Reviews.Title: “Seemed a bit pricey.”
Reviews.Author: NYCityTravelers
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine for a one-night stay for work. The hotel lobby appears to have been renovated, but the bathroom in my room seemed a bit dated. My second floor room looked directly toward the water. Ate lunch and dinner across the street at Anthony’s, which is great for sitting outside with a view of the water. The business center is quite small with just two computers only one of which seemed to be able to print. A Starbucks is conveniently located in an office building about 30 or so steps from the hotel entrance. At $239 (without tax) and $290 (with tax), I did not feel the hotel was a great value, although I later heard that a large convention was in town which likely affected the room price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: allauction
Reviews.Content: Make sure you ask for a view of the harbor otherwise you may face a hill or parking lot. Standard Marriott with a location that is convenient to the harbor, downtown and Pike's Market. Comfortable stay for a visit to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Location for a Seattle Vacation”
Reviews.Author: onthegoallthetime57
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for it's great location for all the Seattle attractions. On arrival we were upgraded to an ocean view which was really nice. Getting in late we opted for room service. Our experience was very bad,they called back twice to say they were out of things and when we got the pint of ice cream we found it was already opened and used. They did bring us another one unopened.The next morning at breakfast we opted for a light fare and it wasn't busy. After a 39 min wait we still had no food. The waiter apologized many times and brought the manager over.We told him about our room service experience and now this. He apologized and offered us a free meal of our choice and took the room service off our bill and paid for our breakfast. On return to our room we had a bottle of wine with cheese and crackers and a note from this manager apologizing for what happened. We felt they had more than made up for our bad experience. When a hotel reacts in this way instead of ignoring bad service I am convinced that they have good management and are concerned about their reputation. We did order room service again after coming back late from Victoria BC and it was GREAT! Before the manager talked with us we would not have returned and would have warned others not to book this hotel. It is a wonderful location,the rooms are very clean and comfortable,the service improved 100% and we left with good memories of our Seattle vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: KoKonutGirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week. We were upgraded which I guess meant we were given a higher floor room with a balcony facing the water. The rooms were alittle small and the balcony was the size of a postage stamp (square about 3'x3') but we faced the waterfront so that was nice. The hotel is a shaped like a double U so we could have gotten a room that just looked into another room with only a slight water view and no balcony. Location is great with an elevator/stairs right next door that comes out a block away from Pike's Market. Lots of places to eat within walking distance (try Etta's) as well a short walk to the Aquarium,. Slightly longer distance to downtown shopping area with one major hill to climb. The room was comfy and clean. My one complaint is that at times the A/C would make a knocking noise ar night. Also, you need to pay for parking. We never ate in the hotel but the bar area and restaurants looked nice with one restaurant having outdoor seating. Pool on 2nd floor was indoor/outdoor. Sofa seating looked comfy but it was a sunny Seattle day and the pool was crowded so we didn't get to use them. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Front desk representative Joe K”
Reviews.Author: KSCAtl
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel! Great location, clean rooms and very friendly staff. Special thanks to Joe K, front dest rep for making our stay extra special! He was wonderful to work with. I highly recommend this hotel. Karen C

Reviews.Title: “Before and after the cruise”
Reviews.Author: Gypsiescollect
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, across from cruise ship dock. Walk to Pike Market, Aquarium and downtown. Nice room, first trip with wheelchair, had to use theirs, which we complained about. Next week when we returned, they had purchased a nice transport chair. Staff was good, concierge went the extra mile. Busy place, nice waterfront bar, rest. spot. WiFi in room was expensive. Free in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location for tourists”
Reviews.Author: onesmileygirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Waterfront three days in May. It has an excellent location for tourists (Not so great for business travelers). The rooms are average, but clean - standard Marriott style. The service was general friendly and helpful - except the bellman to get a cab. Catching a cab in the morning was very difficult - and the hotel was little help. (If you have to leave early in the morning - arrange your car service the night before). It was much easier in the afternoon to get transportation away from the waterfront. Also, computers in the business center were free, but crashed repeatedly and were very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Far overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Stixer
Reviews.Content: The room rate is far over the limit. For close 269$ plus 23.13$ Room Tax plus 18.83$ Occupation Tax plux Valet Parking with no choice of selfparking 34.00$ plus 7.45$ Tax is that hotel a worst pricy hotel. No internet, rooms are standart. The Balcony is redicoules small and the view extreme poor.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: mdtraveler1237
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at some other hotels in Seatlle we were awed by the Marriott Waterfront. It is in the perfect location allowing you to walk to Pike's Place Market and the nearby restaurants and shops on the piers. If you are lucky you can get a view of the sound from your room to watch the ferries come and go. The concierge was helpful in recommending a nice restaurant within walking distance. The atmosphere is luxurious and the service is very good. We have stayed here before and will do so again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: wine2love2
Reviews.Content: Smaller Marriott with bar and coffee shop. Location is perfect. You are right across the street from the waterfront. All rooms have water view. Less than 10 minutes walking from Seattle Aquarium and Pike's Place. Many choices of restaurants very close by. Staff and rooms were also great. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Miviva
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for everything we wanted to do in Seattle-close to the ferry, close to the Market and downtown. Everything was very nice in terms of service and quality. The bed was great! We had a terrific room with a balcony view of the harbor and West Seattle. However, I agree with other reviewers that the room price is relatively expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A BIG DISAPPOINTMENT”
Reviews.Author: cgw13
Reviews.Content: Our cruise to Alaska for a week meant we required an hotel, albeit for no more than one night at a time, both before and after the cruise. Previous experience of Marriott hotels in the UK had been so good that we looked no further than the Waterfront as it offered us proximity to both the pier and downtown Seattle. Unfortunately we were extremely disappointed on the eve of our cruise, not with the accommodation itself, but because it simply failed to match the Marriott experiences we had in England. The rooms on both days were clean and comfortable and the view across the waterfront splendid. However, we have been used to a full English breakfast being included in the price, bottled water supplied without charge and ample tea and coffee making facilities in the room. This is where the Waterfront fell well short of expectation and bearing in mind the price we can honestly say we have experienced far better in from 3* hotels and B&B accommodation. On returning at the end of our cruise we actually checked in at 10.30am and was told our room would not be available until 1.00pm. We expected no more and, having left our baggage in their care, spent the rest of the morning exploring the city. We returned at 2.00pm only to be informed that the room would not be available until 4.00pm. Our opinion of Marriott Hotels had taken a severe hammering. Is it asking too much of an hotel that charges $334.08 a night and can equip a room with 12 lights and 8 pillows to at least provide breakfast, a minibar and ample tea and coffee making facilities? We think not and although we will be returning to Seattle again in the not too distant future, the Marriott Waterfront is the one hotel we will certainly not consider.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay... and a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: MaunaKeaFan
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Marriott Waterfront and could not ask for anything nicer! The hotel is conveniently located to everything you want to see in Seattle (two blocks from the Market, on the Waterfront and within walking distance of the Aquarium, close to the Sculpture Garden, convenient to Pioneer Square and the Stadiums (we walked to a Mariners game), plus within easy walking distance to great shopping at Nordstrom's and Macy's). The staff was exceptionally helpful and pleasant. The concierge was outstanding - her restaurant recommendations were perfect and she always assisted us with our reservations and walking directions (we didn't have a car, no need due to city's ‘walkability’ and great public transportation). Our room was immaculately clean and the housekeeping staff was super! The pool was nice and the Jacuzzi provided welcome relief for our ‘tired’ muscles (from the many miles walked each day!). When we return to Seattle - we know exactly where we'll stay! The location alone made this a great choice, but the staff made our stay exceptional. For us, the Marriott was perfect – we quite simply couldn’t ask for anything better. Day trip on the Victoria Clipper to the San Juan Islands was a highlight. Great to be on the water and to see all the wildlife (seals, porpoise, whales, etc…). Friday Harbor was a fun afternoon visit and we'd highly recommend it – make sure you take time to visit the Lime Kiln Point and lighthouse. Great restaurants in Seattle included Wild Ginger, Queen City Grill, Il Fornaio, the Pink Door, and Salty’s at Alki Point. For breakfast, Lowell’s was perfect. For sites, make sure you visit Kerry Park for the best views in Seattle! St. James Cathedral was also a pleasant surprise for us! Great City! Fantastic Weekend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JMCAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed two nights in the Marriott Waterfront Seattle. Hotel was very nice, the staff was friendly, and the room was fine. Best thing about the hotel, however, was its great location right across the street from the waterfront, and only about 2-3 blocks from the Pike Marketplace. Definitely a great place to stay to explore downtown Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average stay.”
Reviews.Author: nkereina1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with two other adults for one night on July 4th. I was visiting family in Olympia and we decided to travel to Seattle for the fireworks, and then easy access to Sea-Tac airport for me to leave the next day. We arrived around 4pm and checked in with no problem. I had a special rate for the room and my total for the stay including parking was $125 however the front desk authorized my debit card for $175. I'm not sure why they held so much, but it was a little irritating since it tied up my funds for the night. There were some old room service plates outside our door when we arrived at our room, however the room was clean. I'm not sure why they were not removed. Bell services promptly delivered our luggage after check-in, but did not remove the plates, and housekeeping quickly delivered extra towels but also did not remove the plates. They stayed there for the whole duration of our stay. The room itself was very well decorated. The bathroom and TV were both great. My only complaint about the room itself is that it had two full size beds rather than queen size. If there wasn't so much "extra" furniture, like the corner chair and table by the window, I think queens would have fit. The location of the hotel could not be beat. It was directly across from the water with easy walking access to the restaurants, shops and attractions on the water in either direction. There was a lack of parking in the area so we were forced to use valet parking for $34, however we encountered no problems with valet. While we were there, the hotel was one of the host hotels for a national Lions club convention that was in town. The news reported to expect thousands in the city and to expect ample traffic due to the parade the following day. Because of this, I decided to stop at the Concierge desk to ask about the best route to the airport the next day and also where we should watch the Lake Union fireworks without going to the crowded Gasworks Park. We were waiting at the Concierge desk for just a few minutes behind a couple receiving directions, when the Concierge leaned over and said to us very rudely: "I'm finishing with this group and then I have to go, can you see if the front desk can help you?" I told her the line at the front desk was long and she seemingly rolled her eyes and said "I'll be right with you". I stood there for a minute baffled that she would end her shift without helping us when Marriott is so big on customer service, and also why we would want to check with the front desk when the Concierge is supposed to be the knowledgable one in the hotel about this. A few minutes later, she leaned over again asking us what we needed. I told her and she rolled her eyes and sighed and said "well there's eight restaurants on Lake Union where you can see fireworks". I stopped her right there. I did not ask for restaurant recommendations and I certainly wasn't going to take quick recommendations to get rid of me while she was still helping the first people. She was useless. I went outside and asked the bellman who was about 20 years old. Though he did not know much in regards to what I was asking, he was much more pleasant and helpful. At check-out, the front desk clerk gave us great directions to the airport avoiding the parade route, which contradicted the bellman's directions from the previous night which actually crossed the parade route. I was disgusted with this Concierge experience and thought that since this Lions club convention was staying there, perhaps they should have been more well staffed and prepared for questions like this. We did not get to use the pool but it was very nice with both indoor and outdoor features, and the workout room was a great size with nice offerings. Regardless of my one bad experience, I would choose to stay here again if the price was right because of the location, amenities and decor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not as nice as I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: lag746
Reviews.Content: When we first got to Seattle we stayed at the Courtyard in Pioneer Square for two nights. It really was a great hotel. Everything I had requested was given to me on the first shot. I will be writing another review for that location but it definitely put my expectations high for the waterfront considering it's more expensive. The lobby at the waterfront was also deceiving because it's really nice so I was expecting a lot. I get a marriott associate rate, so I'm not sure if that was why they put me in the worst room possible at first. I know it's not guaranteed, but I requested a high floor room with 1 king sized bed. Instead I got a 3rd floor room with 2 double beds so quickly I asked to be changed. They put me in a room on the 2nd floor with a king bed but considering our rate, I wasn't too picky. When we got to the 2nd floor, it stank like old stale dusty... I don't even know. That's fine it's not like I'm hanging out in the hallway but when we got into the room it was worse. There was no ventilation and when I looked out the window we faced a concrete wall and below was the valet parking. When I went into the bathroom, it smelt like somebody had just pooped in it. I was tired and I didn't want to change rooms, but there was no way I was using the bathroom. Also the hotel is badly laid out so the walk from the elevator to the room was really long. The front desk lineup was a nightmare, there were only 2 people working and the lineup just kept forming. When I finally got to the front, I asked for a room change. The nice front desk guy (different from the first one) put me on the 6th floor and in a good location where I could see the waterfront. The room was well ventilated. I was much happier. However did I really have to do 2 room changes in order for me to get a decent room? As for the room itself, the carpets were ugly and the walls were a bit too thin for my liking. I could hear kids yelling in the bathroom from beside me when I was in the bathroom. I also heard toilets flushing and people dropping things etc. In Courtyard Pioneer, I didn't have that issue. I couldn't hear anyone there. I was hoping they'd have a mini fridge and there wasn't one supplied. Courtyard had one. Apparently there is no free internet at this hotel either but I was close to the lobby and was able to get the Wifi reception from down there. I won't be staying at this marriott again unless I really need to be at this location. It's an elevator ride up to pike place market so it's really convenient. I wouldn't recommend the hotel itself to anyone though unless you're strictly needing to be on the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ASM129
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed this hotel especially its location across from the water and within a short walk, uphill albeit, to Pike Market. The Sunday Brunch at the hotel restaurant was outstanding bar none. I was kind of disappointed in the regular menu during the week for the restaurant but the Sunday Brunch made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and views”
Reviews.Author: jpl88
Reviews.Content: Nice trouble free stay in a water view room. Room was on the small side but comfortable and well appointed. Location is perfect, on the waterfront but near the elevator that takes you up to Pikes Place market. Would stay here again on a future trip to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on Seattle waterfront”
Reviews.Author: Prof01
Reviews.Content: The hotel is across a 4-lane road from Elliot Bay but there's a traffic stop switch right outside the hotel so you can stop traffic quickly. Going the other way (up) there's an elevator (and stairs) to get you up the hill to the downtown stores and Pikes Place Market (10 minutes away). Be prepared for steep hills. Good seafood restaurant with great views of bay across the street. More restaurants within 5-10 minute walk. Cruise ships dock diagnally across from hotel and a Japanese training vessel was berthed directly across during our visit. Walking distance to statue park to the right and bay and harbor cruises, etc. to the left. So hotel is in a great location. Our room (upgrade but not the most costly) faced directly to the bay so we could see the Japanese ship and the tail end of the cruise ships. Super view. Some other rooms with small balconies were at right angles to the bay so you would need to be on the balcony to really see the water very much. Staff was friendly enough. Room was clean, but housekeeping cleaned the rooms later than normal (early afternoon). We really never saw the housekeeping carts clogging the hallways as you do in most hotels. System seemed to work well. Ate one meal (breakfast) in the hotel restaurant - a buffet with somewhat limited offerings but was there (including omelet station & very fresh, ripe fruit) was very good eating. Wired Internet in rooms for $12.95/day. When will Marriott get it?! Free wireless in public areas, although our room (#658) was able to access the free Wi-Fi. Refrigerator in room - no honor bar. All in all, a very good stay. We'd definitely go back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location. Quite & Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SEOCharlie
Reviews.Content: It was my third year in Seattle, attending an event at the Bell Harbor, just across the street of the Marriott Waterfront hotel. The location is awesome. You can find an elevator just at the side that will take you thru the main street –Western- of the Pike Place Market. It has a very nice pool area, including a small fitness centre. The rooms are quite and very clean. The staff is very friendly, always with a smile in their faces. Internet connection is fast; including the wireless (WiFi) but you should pay for that – not included on the room price-. Just two final advices: If you like nightlife maybe you should stay at other hotel downtown. The area looks safe but few people around after midnight. Ask for the balcony rooms –nice view of the port-but check your curtains; the neighborhood can be looking at you :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Awesome Staff”
Reviews.Author: Rymo2300
Reviews.Content: The cream of the crop when it comes to Marriot. While the brand speaks for itself, often times some of their hotels stand out. This is one of those stand outs. The hotel is situated right on Alaskan Way and is perfectly located to explore the city and wake up with a fabulous view of the Puget Sound. Just make sure to ask for a room with the sound view otherwise you may be looking at a courtyard of the neighboring condos. Staff is excellent and accommodating, food is fantastic, but pricey so go grab dinner down the street if you don't have to have dinner at the hotel if only to experience Seattle a bit more. Great hotel, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect waterfront location”
Reviews.Author: wavesplasher
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a king balcony/waterfront room, which was wonderful. The pool area is really nice. Half the pool is outside, half inside, with plenty of chairs to soak up the sun, if the sun actually comes out. The elevator to access Pike Place Market is right next to the hotel, a big plus. The Seattle Aquarium is only a few blocks away and the walk to get there is along the waterfront, so it's very pretty. One of the cruise ship companies boards right across the street from the Marriott, but the ship left for its cruise at about 5 p.m. so our waterview was preserved. There is a restaurant affiliated with the hotel, but we ate our meals out, so I can't rate the bistro restaurant. Parking is $34 per night. No free in-room internet, but you can use wifi in the lobby, which is huge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, spotless hotel, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: OlyFoodie
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel. This is the 3rd time we've stayed and it is always our first choice in Seattle. The location is fantastic - walk to the Aquarium, Pike Place Market, lots of shopping and many restaurants are within walking distance. The rooms are always very clean and the staff is very attentive. The pool is small but the pool deck has a beautiful view and nice seating, and my kids love that that can swim inside and outside.

Reviews.Title: “Seattle Waterfront is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: MizLiz41
Reviews.Content: We always stay at Marriott hotels, but this one was new to us. Now we won't stay anywhere else when we go to Seattle. Great seafood restaurant across the street, Seattle Acquarium within walking distance, and quite close to Qwest field. (We're baseball fans) Friendly bartenders, and great happy hour snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel on the waterfront”
Reviews.Author: travelerwmmary
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in ideal location for visiting the waterfront, Pike Place Market or downtown Seattle. Across from the marina and a great restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Place; ideal for people taking a cruise out of Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Avirat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel between May 26-29, 2011. Excellent rooms with good facilities. Walking distance from the cruise terminal. Has facility to transport the luggage to the cruise terminal. Once your luggage is transported to the vessel you have the liberty to board hassle free any time you like. Well appointed rooms with good free bathroom accessories. Kid friendly. Good bar. located walking distance from Pike Place market. One thing missing is the free internet. Great bar with outdoor sitting. Over all expensive but worth it. good for the business traveller and people taking cruise out of Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “No wireless internet, not free”
Reviews.Author: RyHutch
Reviews.Content: Its a nice hotel with friendly staff. The majore downfall is the internet situation. Personally, when travel for business I find it very annoying for a hotel to not have wireless internet. Not only do they not have wireless (in downtown Seattle) but they only have DSL connection in the wall that i have to plug into. And they want to charge me $12 per day for DSL? What a rip off. I would reccomend one of the many other hotels nearby with wireless internet (or at least complimentary internet)

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough but best for NCL and Celebrity cruisers - not for us”
Reviews.Author: mommabean
Reviews.Content: The people who work her are very nice. The hotel is well cared for and clean. There is only free wifi in the lobby which surprised me. At this point in time, I'd expect to find wifi in the room AND free. You can plug in your laptop in your room at a charge. After all I read in reviews about views, I was surprised to find such a small hotel with very few floors. Our room was tucked towards the back of a U shaped building on the forth floor with water views obstructed to the left and right and a great view of the balcony of the room on the perpendicular hall. Fortunately, I don't think anyone was staying in that room or they'd have a view of the inside of my room while the curtains were open. We were not here for a cruise but we do enjoy cruising so watching the ships in port each day were of interest to us. We even walked the 2 miles to the other cruise port to see the other cruise lines including our favorite - Royal Caribbean. Only Celebrity and NCL use the port directly in front of the hotel. You'll find traffic back ups in the morning when a ship arrives in port. It was an easy walk, although probably too steep for some people, to Pike Place. If you like Seattle downtown nightlife, this isn't the place for you. There is a not so nice area to walk through when coming back to the hotel from downtown. This area is called bell town. I felt extremely uncomfortable on our walk back. We had a fabulous salmon taco at the place across the street right in front of the ship. I'd be happy to stay here before a cruise. Otherwise I'd find a place in the heart of downtown. This is a nice, well run hotel. I didn't find the views to be so great. And I didn't like the location at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: maryjohn29
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Seattle with my husband and 2 young children to attend a family wedding. Knowing that we would be spending a lot of time away from our room, I didn't want to spend a lot of money on one, so we had your basic, standard hotel room. It was clean, comfortable, with 2 full-sized beds. It was a bit smaller than I would have liked given there were 4 people plus all our luggage. There was no microwave and no armoire, just a dresser with 3 or 4 small drawers on one side and the refrig on the other; the TV was located on top. Guests have to pay a steep price to park their car during their stay, plus the hotel charges you for internet service. They do offer the use of washers and dryers at no charge, located the 2nd floor, if guests choose to do laundry during their stay. Great, casual restaurant on the first floor, where you can eat inside or out. We had breakfast there each morning and it was terrific! Friendly staff, and wonderful location on the Alaskan Way!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Robfur
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a function. Hotel and the room was nice. Overall, a very good stay. The one negative is parking. Only street parking and some garages are available. I thought the valet parking ($41 a night) was high but I hear other hotels charge the same. Either way that is high.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Waterfront Location - Fabulous Views”
Reviews.Author: baycityart
Reviews.Content: I am the meeting planner for a 400 person group that recently met at this hotel. Our group loved the place and they enjoyed excellent food at our various functions, gorgeous views of Elliott Bay and very pleasant accommodation. The Dungeness Crab Benedict at the 2100 Restaurant is not to be missed. The luncheon fish sandwich was better than Anthony's across the street. Not all rooms have super water views. Spend a little extra for a Bay Front room. The concierge lounge features excellent breakfasts and a friendly staff. Worth paying extra. My only criticisms are the snotty front desk crew particularly a tall guy who seems to have an attitude and the ultra expensive valet parking. This hotel offers a fabulous Seattle waterfront experience. It can be pricey but you'll never forget the gorgeous views.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay in midst of tourist area”
Reviews.Author: Provost2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for two nights along with my father-in-law while we did our first trip to Seattle. The city was surprisingly small and easily manageable compared to what I was expecting. I thought of something more along the scale of Vancouver, Canada... but the city core was much smaller. Seattle has also done a great job of integrating their marine and fishing history into the city. We couldn't have asked for a better hotel location as it was right on the waterfront, only a couple of blocks from Pike Place Market, and only about a 15-20 minute walk from the Space Needle. The hotel itself was a bit of an older version of a standard Marriott, but had the nice comfy beds you come to expect from the brand (and one of the main reasons I stay). My room was supposed to have a king sized bed, but I suspect it was a queen as it seemed much smaller than our king size at home. The room is standard, with a flat screen TV and a small refrigerator if you have some snacks or drinks to keep cool. Most rooms seems to have a view of the water, we were on the 3rd floor and had a decent view. We did hear the train come by a couple of times as it is right behind the hotel, but it isn't loud enough to disturb your sleep. When we first opened the door we did smell quite a powerful blast of bleach so we did know that the room and linens were clean... though if you have a big sensitivity to that it could be a bigger issue. My father-in-law had the same smell in his room and noticed it on the sheets/pillows when he was sleeping. The pool is interesting, it is quite small but is half inside and half outside. I was able to swim in late March but the pool was a little chilly to be really comfortable. The hot tub is also very small and can't accomodate more than two people unless you are on very friendly terms. We didn't try the hotel restaurant as the prices were higher than other nearby ones outside the hotel. They did have a cheaper cafe but it was similar in price to the Starbucks that was just across the entry. For tourist activities I would suggest the Duck Tour which gives you a nice overview of the city layout. We did it as soon as we arrived and it gave us our bearings quite well. We also did the Argosy harbour tour which was nice since the weather was spectacular, and the underground tour which was very interesting. We ate at Ivar's for dinner just a few blocks stroll down the waterfront and were perfectly happy with it. We ended up sitting in the lounge and ordering off the "happy hour" menu (good from 3pm until close) which was about 1/3 of the price of the main menu and the portions were perfectly sufficient for us. We didn't eat at the Crab Pot as the reviews on Tripadvisor weren't very good. Some hints for getting around: - there is apparently a free bus that goes right along the waterfront, we didn't know this until we were leaving - take a taxi or bus to the Space Needle, the walk is uphill and fairly arduous... it is an easy walk back to the hotel though since it is downhill - to go to Pike Place Market, take the parkade elevator just to the right of the hotel (when facing from the waterfront). It saves you a hundred stairs or so and deposits you on the right level - parking is expensive everywhere, at the hotel it will run you $40 per day including taxes. I suggest leaving your car when going out to the tourist attractions since parking will be more than taxis wherever you go. - the monorail doesn't take you anywhere you likely want to go, so unless you just want to go on it for the sake of going... don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Girls Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: mcfbar
