Reviews.Content: We go away every year to celebrate our favorite Irish holiday; St. Patrick's Day. This year was my choice and I always wanted to visit the city of Seattle. We picked the Marriott Waterfront for our stay, four girls, two rooms. We needed two connecting rooms with four beds and when I called to confirm it, the lady assured me it would not be an issue and it wasn't.. We checked in early and our rooms were ready. The rooms were clean and very convenient. Our favorite thing about the hotel is its location and prioxity to all walking areas in downtown Seattle. We also enjoyed their breakfast buffet daily. It was the perfect hotel for our annual Girls Getways.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: patriotic
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week and even though I checked in late, I was given a beautiful king room, overlooking the water. I had a great view of the bay, ferries, etc. Unfortunately, it was cold and raining so, I couldn't really enjoy it. But, the location is also fantastic; only a few blocks from Pike Place Market and other great shops and restaurants. I like the fact that the hotel is in a quieter location. The rooms were spotless. Nice comfy, beds, large screen TV, clean and well-stocked bathroom (L'Occitane toiletries), etc. The staff was great. I did eat at the hotel restaurant for breakfast. The food was great, including the house-smoked salmon. There were lots of options and nice service. I would definitely go back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Staff but hidden costs abound.”
Reviews.Author: OCD4ME
Reviews.Content: When registering your reservation please be sure to ask about hidden costs. I was very pleased with my rate of $134 only have $11.52 in room tax, $9.38 in Occ tax, $34 parking, $3.23 prktax, $4.25 City Park tax. Total of $62.38 of additional charges that should have been revealed while I was making my reservation. Would NOT have stayed here if I knew the true cost of the room was $196.38. Hotel was nice, staff was nice and no other disappointments with the exception of poor parking availability unless you pay $34 a night for your car to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location”
Reviews.Author: seqtraveler
Reviews.Content: Welcoming staff, beautiful entry and great location makes this hotel one of my favorites in Seattle. The room was spacious, beds very comfortable and bathroom good size and spotless. The view of Puget Sound, ferries and Olympic Mountains from our small balcony was very nice. We did not use the restaurant, but did stop in at the lounge. The waitstaff were very attentive, and prices are reasonable. This location is within walking distance to many restaurants, the Market and public transportation. The only downside is the parking. They do have valet parking for $39 per night. However, if you stay on a Saturday night, there is free street parking after 6 p.m. and all day Sunday. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: RandyBarber
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay here. The pool area is enjoyable. My spouse and I prefer quieter, cozy locals with a little less concrete and a little less price. Thats not the Hotels fault just the way we see it.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading and expensive!!”
Reviews.Author: princessjj
Reviews.Content: We just recently visited Seattle. I picked this hotel because of it's location and due to the fact that when I called, they said that since we were "Marriot Rewards" members (long standing with tons of points) we would be eligible for an upgrade to a junior suite at no charge. This was important as we had a babysitter who was going to come watch our kids so we could go out with old friends in Seattle. We were hoping for a large room or a suite to help with that. The person I spoke to on the phone assured us that if the suite was available, we WOULD be upgraded...no question. So, when we checked in, we were told (by a completely bored front desk person) that there were suites available....for $642.00/night. Are you insane??? That is the same price of two rooms at the Four Seasons!! Anyhow, we said no thanks, went up to our room that was supposed to have 2 queens. It was 2 full size beds and was TINY!! With two adults and two kids, it was horrible. If we were paying less I would not care but it was $220/night! The room also smelled like chlorine even though the pool was 1 floor down from our room. It was reasonably clean but we checked out the next morning and ended up getting a suite, at the WAC, on the top floor, for 1/2 the price of the room at the Marriot. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: GoTBGo
Reviews.Content: One night stay for a shopping excursion with the spouse. Upgraded to a corner suite room which was huge. Location of the property is very convinient, right on the water and a short walk to Pike St Market and downtown shopping. The staff was outstanding. They not only accomodated our requests but were extremely pleasant and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Highly accommodating, will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: HereOnBiz
Reviews.Content: In town for a conference, I had booked a room at a hotel across the street from this one because it had a lower conference rate. I was HIGHLY displeased with the first hotel & called the Marriott to see if they could accommodate me. They were exceptionally kind & got me a room straight away, and even honored the conference rate, which had expired a month ago. They also put me in a room on an upper floor, which meant I got a free deluxe breakfast and free cocktails in a private lounge on the top floor, at no additional charge. The rooms were spacious, well-lit, and clean. Everyone was nice that worked there, including housekeeping. Even the rooms with a "bad" view still had a good one, and the curtains closed completely so that it became dark enough in the room to sleep. The conference I attend is held in Seattle every other year and I will not hesitate to stay in the Marriot next time. I think this hotel is also nice for vacation travelers. Note for business travelers: the desk is HUGE and has a power plug in it!

Reviews.Title: “Well below average and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Andrey_Buzin
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in the hotel during my business trip. The only good thing I can recall is good location near the sea. Rooms are quite ordinary, and cheaper one had no diference to more expensive except that the latter had a sea/road view and respectively was noisier. Breakfast was quite ordinary. Everything was OK for a 3 1/2* service, but the hotel was marked as 4*! Most surprising actually was price. I've lived in many Marriott hotels, and this is 60% more expensive than some much better than this. Can't see why.

Reviews.Title: “VGS”
Reviews.Author: mikeythebe
Reviews.Content: Great property, Nice rooms most all with a harbour view, impressive lobby, great service in restaurants and bars

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: ILoveAZ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little off the activity area of downtown, but still a very reasonanable walk to Pike Marketplace, the Aquarium, downtown shopping, etc. Rooms are basic for a Marriott, but comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Yoga_Explorer
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel right on the water in downtown Seattle. We're generally low-maintenance, so we had no huge demands to place on the hotel staff, but overall they were friendly without being overbearing. Our room was clean and comfortable with a view of the water. Pretty facility overall, with water-inspired local art.

Reviews.Title: “Not the fanciest Marriott on the planet...”
Reviews.Author: busterfreak
Reviews.Content: Not the fanciest Marriott on the planet, but its location - convenient to both Pike Place and downtown Seattle - makes up for a lot. Let's start with the good: The lobby, bar and restaurant are all nice and comfortable. I could have done without the constant house music, but hey: when you're that close to the Edgewater (maybe two blocks away), you gotta compensate somehow. And now for the less-than-good: let's face it, Marriott's rooms are pretty blah. Nothing special once you get past the lobby. And it's a shame, because I love marriott's beds and the concierge lounge was a pleasant surprise here, what with yummy veggies and goat cheese and dessert every night except Friday and Saturday. But overall, the Marriott Waterfront is a nice place in a very nice location with adequate creature comforts and a capable staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to stay before an Alaska cruise”
Reviews.Author: bonnieboot
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights prior to our cruise to Alaska. The room was a great size and had a very comfortable bed and also a small balcony that overlooked the pier. We got to see the ship arrive in port the morning of our cruise. We just had to roll our luggage across the street to board the ship in the afternoon which was a wonderful convenience. Room service was great and quick too. The bar downstairs was a nice addition to our evening visit to a blues club within walking distance to the hotel. Restaurants and the market were all within walking distance. We will definitely go back to Seattle and stay there even without cruising. We also ate breakfast at the hotel and the food and service were both great.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently a good choice”
Reviews.Author: craignsandra
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here several times in the past couple of years and each time has been a pleasant experience. The service has been consistently great, the food good, the rooms clean, comfortable with great views. The location is convenient, and the cost is comparable to other area hotels in the same category, but the Waterfront rates a consistent 4+ in every category. It is one of our favorite hotels in Seattle, no complaints here.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed it – would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Meg56
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned a last minute trip to Seattle to celebrate our anniversary. We really enjoyed this hotel. The rooms don't have modern/trendy design, they're more classic, but it's luxurious and the location is excellent. The staff were very friendly. We were given a room on a high floor, with a small balcony. We were on the side, but close to the front of the building so had a partial ocean view. I would definitely ask for a room with a balcony again next time. The indoor/outdoor pool is small but nice. It's easy to park on the street out front or in the lot across from the entrance, if you don't want to do valet. It was a bit expensive, but I'd stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: keane75
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel as one would expect from this chain, but very impersonal. I emailed hotel prior to our arrival to let them know it was a special occasion (25th wedding anniversary) asked for robes but did not get them. We paid quite a lot for a waterfront elliot bay view with balcony, which was very nice but not stunning as I had expected. In fact stayed at a fantastic Best Western at Rivers Edge in Orofino and booked a suite which was 100% nicer! I'm sure it is convienient for those going on a cruise but I will stay at another Hotel before going back.

Reviews.Title: “One time is enough”
Reviews.Author: quickdraw_10
Reviews.Content: We heard about this Hotel in a wedding invitation and booked sight unseen. I must say we were happy with the room and view. We noticed how quiet the rooms were, couldn't hear our neighbors or street noise and beautiful view of Elliott Bay. The Woman on staff who was assigned to our room made sure we were comfortable and went out of her way to make sure we felt welcome. But I was put off by $ 40.00 a day to park your car and $ 17.00 for a waffle that I think I saw being poured from a pre-mix and $ 2.25 for a cup of coffee gave me heartburn. If there was a business center I could not find it and no signs to indicate otherwise. Charging for internet service in your room? Are you kidding. Staff was friendly and the guys who parked the cars were extremely pleasant and helpful geting us around town. Proximity to the Boarwalk, Pikes Market and wide variety of good resturants in the area was a plus. We were not familiar with the area and were looking for a Concierge but had to rely on the front desk staff for assistance when they were not helping other travelers. I'm sure it is convienient for those going on a cruise but I will stay at another Hotel before thinking on going back.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Way to Spend a Weekend”
Reviews.Author: dralbertfish
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Waterfront is located right across the street from Pier 31 on the Elliot Bay waterfront in downtown Seattle. We have stayed at this hotel several times in the past and always been very happy with the service and the high quality of the rooms. When we arrived shortly after 12pm to try to check in early we were greeted by the desk person who welcomed us back after seeing that we were repeat customers. He was glad to inform us that there was a room available for us and we checked in and went to our sixth floor room overlooking the bay. There are always things to see from one of the bay view rooms and today we were greeted by a cruise ship preparing for departure. I stronly recommend this hotel if you are in Seattle for business or pleasure. There are many restaurants nearby although I would avoid Anthony's and make my way up to Western and eat at Ettas. One Sunday morning we walked down to the Edgewater for breakfast which has stunning views also but is a bit expensive. The Marriott is expensive but luxurious and is everything you'd expect in a hotel of this caliber. As always the hotel charges for internet which is a crime in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: sfmrb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night going and coming from Victoria. First night on a Sunday, got a nice upgrade to a corner room facing the water. Very nice. Second night on a Friday, got a mid room. The elevated freeway is right behind the hotel, so a little bit of low level rumble during the night. Not too bad. Very convenient to tourist stuff, both the waterfront and Pike's Market.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous room & view plus great staff”
Reviews.Author: Lokiteaka
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night in June. We did not arrive until 9pm, and we were tired from driving all day to get to Seattle. We had no reservation, but that was no problem. We were checked in swiftly - the check in staff were fantastic - and the valet were great friendly guys, with lots of local knowledge. We stayed on the top floor in a corner room, so the view was spectacular. Room service meals were good and the toiletries are real nice. The room was beautifully decorated and the bed was very comfy and we didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view - Nice overall hotel”
Reviews.Author: gjnbln
Reviews.Content: It is great to be able to open you window and see the ocean! This hotel has teh advantage of being in the best spot in Seattle, so it is really hard for it to miss. The rooms are nice and clean. The lobby is inviting as well as the bar. The restaraunt is nothing special and expensive. Overall this place is on the expensive side, however, it was worth it with the view and location along the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Mixed Service”
Reviews.Author: sdavi
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Marriott for 3 nights to start our Northwest vacation and our review is mixed. Although I made one reservation for two rooms they put the rooms on separate floors. We had to wait past 5pm for two rooms on the same floor. Then the air conditioned in the second room would only blow hot air. They did correct the problem by giving us an awesome corner room (very spacious with nice views of Pugent Sound). In the end it was a great location. The cafe had excellent food selection and prompt service. The restaurant was the complete opposite. We have terrible service; our waiter finally admitted to giving our food to another table when we asked him why our meals were taking exceeding long (we waited over 30 minutes for french toast and an omelet). In the end the food was mediocre at best. So, I would recommend staying here for the location but just don't eat in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: coralprincesscake
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel and just like the first one, I have no complaints! Beautiful hotel, great location, excellent service. We originally chose this hotel because of the proximity to the cruise terminals. NCL is right across the street, Princess and Holland America are a 10-15 minute drive down the street. I booked two rooms for one night using my Marriott points about six months ago. We arrived from the airport using Seattle Limo and Towncar Association, which was recommended by the hotel (great service). We checked in around 400 with no problems and the rooms were ready. 434 and 437, both had double beds, were very clean, smelled good and had partial views. We headed up to Pike Place Market, which is about a 5-7 minute walk, had an awesome dinner at Pike Place Brewery. It should be noted that a small portion of the walk is slightly uphill. There is a Cost Plus World Market at the top of that hill, which is a good place to buy wine to take onboard the cruise ships. :) Back at the hotel we had a drink downstairs and did some people watching. Everyone slept well, the beds were very comfy and we never heard the train (there are tracks behind the hotel). There were three of us in each room but it never seemed crowded. The bathrooms are large, towels nice and there is shampoo, conditioner and lotion from Crabtree & Evelyn. FREE wi-fi access in the lobby! Also, free internet in the Business Center (which is very small). Small "coffee shop" inside the lobby that serves Starbucks coffee, yogurts and muffins also sells snacks, gifts, newspapers etc. and some travel sized items . There is a Starbucks right next to the hotel (5 second walk from lobby) for those who need more than the lobby offers. We had express check out and there were no "surprise" charges on the bill for either room. All the staff we encountered were helpful and nice. Would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Overpriced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Miker023
Reviews.Content: Right on the waterfront - Staff was good - Had an oceanfront room at $350 a night and it was more like a shoe closet with a bed. Do yourself a favour and do your homework

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced hotel for the quality of amenities.”
Reviews.Author: abn1979
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seattle Marriott Waterfront during the third and last leg of a trip to British Columbia and the Pacific Northwest. We chose the hotel because we usually find Marriotts to have very good quality for a reasonable price. However, we were very disappointed with this choice. The room was small and outdated, and the bed was hard and very uncomfortable. We did not sleep well at any point during our stay. The walls were thinner than most hotel walls and we could hear every noise that was made in the surrounding rooms, including every time someone in one of those rooms took a shower, right down to when they opened and closed the shower curtain. The TV was also apparently set to only go to a certain volume, which was very low, resulting in our hearing other people moving around in their rooms over the TV in our own room. Although the waterfront location was nice, we found that it was noisy and crowded outside on the pier because there was a cruise ship in the port both days we stayed there. Overall, the hotel was just average at best but I felt that we paid an above-average price. We even had to pay for the Internet access (whereas at another, lower-priced and significantly nicer Marriott where we stayed during this same trip we did not). If the price had been significantly lower, I would not be complaining. However, at the price that this hotel charged, we were expecting better quality of services and amenities and find it surprising that this 4-star rated Marriott lacked that quality. We loved Seattle, but likely would not stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel on the water”
Reviews.Author: Andymeg664
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very nice hotel on the waterfront. Many ships dock nearby and it is within walking distance of Pike Place Market and downtown Seattle. The hotel had a business conference there and the area was way too small for the business conference attendees. In addition, the hotel parking is outrageously priced, but you can find cheaper parking nearby. The hotel parking is one rate, but if you park in the nearby garage you have to pay separately in and out, so weigh whether you will be using your car frequently.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location - bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiTravelMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed there June 24-26 before our cruise to Alaska. It was a convenient location to Pikes Market & across from Pier 66 where our cruise embarked. The hotel staff were friendly but they messed up our rooms. We were supposed to have adjoining rooms for our group of 14 people but our 4 rooms ended up on different floors. They gave us a view room of Elliot Bay to make up for the mistake but the view is not much to look at. The rooms are ok but not as nice as other Marriotts. The minibar is hidden under the tv and the rooms and bathrooms are small and do not reflect the $300/night cost. Our shower plugged up the first night but they fixed it promptly the next day. The beds were comfy and everything was clean. The staff were friendly, especially the cleaning staff. We ate in the restaurant for breakfast - it was nothing special. There is an indoor/outdoor pool which the kids loved. There is a glass elevator next to the hotel that takes you up to the street to Pikes Market.. total walk about 5-10 min. It was convenient for my parents with a walker and my 18 mo old in a stroller. We walked to the Pier 57 and ate at the Crab Pot which was a lot of fun. At the end of our stay, the bellhop took our bags all the way to the cruise terminal for check in. Although the rooms were pricey at $700+ for 2 nights per room, it was convenient. Our group of 14 people would recommend it for people going on the NCL cruise to Alaska & sightseeing in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel, location and service great!”
Reviews.Author: penphoto
Reviews.Content: Terrific location...we were able to walk to Pike Market and Space Needle. Very friendly staff. Good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay for Us”
Reviews.Author: caseynicole79
Reviews.Content: We were at this Marriott two nights post cruise and we loved it! The bedding was outstanding, our room was more than spacious (with a balcony overlooking the harbor) and the location was excellent! We did go to the pool and hot tub one evening and had it all to ourselves. On our day of checkout we took advantage of the Platinum member concierge and had breakfast and printed out our boarding passes! If there was one thing to have a complaint about it would be that the staff at the front desk (only there) was just somewhat mediocre. It wasn't that they were rude or mean....just nothing outstanding. From other experiences in Marriott's the staff is usually outstanding but you can't win them all. I loved our choice and if we are ever back into Seattle we will absolutely stay here! Steps from the market, tons of eating, shopping, the Aquarium and the Pier......EXCELLENT!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but better choices in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: brmusicman
Reviews.Content: I had business in the conference center next to this hotel, and so I stayed at the property in May, 2010. The hotel was fine; it delivered on all of the Marriott brand promises and, overall, my stay was in line with my expectations. The hotel was expensive, however. For this visit, the convenience of being next to the conference center on a tight itinerary justified the expense, but if I had the flexibility to stay elsewhere, I would. The hotel just did not deliver a better experience than other hotels that are far cheaper and located nearby. That isn't to say it delivered a bad experience -- just not an experience that was in line with how the room rate compared to other properties of a similar service level in the same vicinity. The lobby of the hotel is quite lovely. The rooms, while not problematic, are the "old" Marriott rooms -- a bit on the small side, very traditional decor (whereas the Marriott rooms feel modern and updated). Some of the rooms have great views of the water; others do not. Thankfully, the hotel did not put any rooms that have windows next to the train track that runs behind the hotel, and I didn't hear any outside noise in my room. The rest of the hotel facilities (concierge lounge, fitness center, business center, etc.) were very nice and pretty standard for a Marriott. Kudos to the hotel for service -- every person I interacted with was friendly, helpful, and seemed to go above and beyond. In one sense, the hotel's location is great, as it's right on the water. It's also very close (up a staircase or elevator) to Pike Place Market, which is a lot of fun. The hotel isn't far from most of the other major downtown Seattle attractions. However, I think many of the other hotels in Seattle have a BETTER location; they're in the center of the action instead of being down on the water and thus have better access to sights, restaurants, etc. The waterfront gets pretty quiet after 6pm or so, while the portions of the city "up the hill" stay alive and feel more vibrant. Overall, a satisfying stay, but probably will look at other hotels when returning to Seattle on business.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Kevinkain
Reviews.Content: The service was great and so was the view from the deck off my room. The valet was first class and the room service was awesome. I will stay here the next time in in Seattle as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, but this place is waaaay too expensive.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTraveler_01
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within walking distance to all the major touristy areas, but it's not the place to stay if you're looking for a relaxing getaway or something that's a little off the beaten path. Also beware of the numerous fees. We paid $200 per night for a hotel room but parking and internet use are extra. (About $30 per day for parking!) You have to request a room that overlooks the water, and again that's extra but probably not worth the money because you'll be closer to a main street with lots of traffic. That being said, the staff was exceptional. Every time I asked for a great restaurant suggestion or wanted to know something about the area, the staff was on top of it. They're friendly and helpful, everything you would hope for and I'd like to thank them for that. I suggest this hotel if it's your first time to Seattle and you'd like to see the more popular sights. Just prepared to fork over a LOT of cash. Do your research, there are other hotels nearby that cost at least $50 to $100 less. I thought this one would be worth it because the rooms look so luxurious on their website, but in reality they're pretty standard.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: Halifaxduo
Reviews.Content: My husband had meetings at the hotel so I tagged along. So we have a combined business/ pleasure travel perspective. He was satisfied with the meeting rooms. I found it to be in a good location for exploration of the city. The gym was under renovation and the pool was not especially inviting. Location: Pros: The hotel is in an excellent location.It is on the waterfront. Just cross the street and you are at a marina. The street elevator is located right BESIDE the hotel-very handy to go up to Pike Place Market Area. There is a #99 Waterfront/Pioneer Square bus which is free of charge.There is a stop across the street from the hotel entrance. There is a great walking/jogging/biking path that goes right by the front of the hotel.It follows the waterfront all the way down past Miners Landing (It is a wharf with shops, restaurants). Walk a little bit past Miners Landing to Elliott's Restaurant -recomended eating spot. Be aware: It is a bit of an uphill walk to get to the downtown shopping area so I took a taxi to Macy's It was only a$5-8 fare.I walked back to the hotel. It was an easy down hill walk Check-in When we made the reservation. we requested a King bed, high floor, water view . It was a conference rate but we were told it would be noted BUT we had to request this again upon check-in. I fiured that perhaps, we might get one of the requests. We were disappointed that upon arrival the ONLY room available was a 4th floor room with two double beds.There was a partial waterview from inside the room. One had to step out onto the small balcony to improve your view but it is still a partial view due to the design of the building The room: Pros: It had a fresh decor. Carpets were obviously new. There was a comfortable armchair & wheeled deskchair.The desk had a pull-out that doubled as a table The linens were atractive and comfortable. Cons: The room was not overly spacious however it was an adequate size - the furniture seemed a bit of a tight fit for the size of the room. There was a regual sized closet however there were only three drawers in the bureau because in the other half there was was a nice empty mini-frig.There was a big flat - screen t.v. on top . Digital not HD, I think The beds were actually double bed size - much more narrow than Queen beds. Despite being awkwardly narrow, they were remarkably comfortable. A bit of a caution: I cannot see how this room would comfortably accomodate 4 people Housekeepng Service: We received exceptional service from Jin-Jin. She looked after our room for the duration of our 5 day stay. She was helpful in meeting our individual preferences- eg) stocking only decaf coffee. She was obviously assigned to our floor thus she became familiar with all the guests in our section - merrily greeting me and offering to be of assistance. This was a notable plus. Room Service: It was good food and prompt service. It was good value Restaurant: There is an enjoyable restaurant on the main floor. We had excellent service and the delicious food was well presented. I suggest eating here at a window table. We were at a table in a private alcove along the entry hall. It provided a nice view plus privacy. Overall impression: The hotel has been renovated and spruced up so it exceeded my expectations given the reviews on TA. I prefered this location rather than staying in the downtown business area where I have stayed before. The waterfront is a distinct asset. It was good value for the cost. My only caution is to temper your expectations regarding room size and water/mountain view. So you can see it is a bit of a mixed review.

Reviews.Title: “Exemplary service and great location”
Reviews.Author: tsurumi
Reviews.Content: I stay at Marriott hotels on business because I know what to expect. This Marriott was truly exceptional. From the concierge to the housekeeping staff, everyone was happy to help and always with a kind word and a smile. It turns out that I was witihin walking distance of all of the offices downtown where I would be working -- although there were one or two steep hills -- but so long as it wasn't raining, it was a nice brisk walk. And, it was also within easy walking distance of Pike Place Market or you could take a free bus from just across the street to take you the Space Needle if you were so inclined.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good views.”
Reviews.Author: surfinginflorida
Reviews.Content: We are platinum Marriott members, so when we are comparing hotels, it is usually Marriott against Marriott. Marriott’s level of service is incredible, so that sets the bar pretty high for all hotels we stay at. At this hotel, the service was fine, but not great like the other Marriott’s we stayed at on the trip – the Bellevue Residence Inn and the Marriott in Victoria, BC. The rooms were fine, the waterfront views were outstanding. The location was very convenient to Pikes Market, the waterfront and the downtown tourist attractions. We enjoyed our weekend and here and will stay and play here again if we go back to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: HarvestMoon
Reviews.Content: We had just one night in Seattle and wanted to visit Pike's Market Place. We chose the Marriott because we wanted to be within walking distance. We had horrible weather (60mp wind gusts) so being close was good but be forewarned - everything seems to be uphill around the waterfront. The hotel was very nice and comfortable. The restaurant and bar had good food and good service. Parking was a litte pricey but not out of line for any Seattle downtown hotel. We would definitely return. If you only have one day in Seattle, stay downtown. There is so much to do and Pikes Market area offered everything from all types of restaurants, market food, department stores, etc. We will try to come back so we can see the museums and spend more time trying out the interesting restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: super66shazbot
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, location and staff. Nice concierge lounge. Right on the waterfront as the hotels name suggests.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: TravelingManSpokane
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in connecting rooms 544 (King) and 542 (2 queens) in April 2010. I booked directly through the hotel and paid $219 per room/per night. My wife grew up in Seattle and we have been trying to stay in a "waterfront" hotel for quite a while. Besides the aging Edgewater Hotel nearby, there just aren't any hotels right on the water in the Emerald City but this is as close as you can get. We loved this hotel! #544 was a corner/waterfront view. It was pretty darn nice as it was, but judging from the pictures submitted by other reviewers it would have been even better on one of the higher floors. The room was modern, clean, and comfortable. We had a front row view of the ferries coming and going, as well as freighters coming into port and other ships and boats of all types and sizes cruising by. Great view! New LG high def flat screen TV. Plenty of room and lots of hangars in the closet. (That's a first!) The hotel has a wonderfully contemporary lobby with lots of artwork and lots of places to sit. The 2100 Bistro has a good restaurant with a nice bar. 2100 also serves a terrific breakfast and lunch. Everyone on the staff was friendly and hardworking. There is a small, two computer terminal business center. Also, a small pool featured in other review pictures. While I was on a treadmill in the fitness center, it was literally being dismantled by workers who were taking equipment pieces away in preparation for remodeling. But the hotel's GM had put out a note to all guests alerting them of the situation and that the gym would be moving next door temporarily. Nice touch to see hotel execs communicate like that. The employee "at your service" lived up to its name. Phone operators pick up the phone and repeat your last name when you call. Again, a nice touch. There are complimentary Wall Street Journals and USA Today newspapers. On site valet parking is expensive as some other reviewers have noted, but you get what you pay for. The ONLY thing I would change is that leaving the hotel by car and trying to turn left (or right) on Alaskan Way is very tricky because there is no stop light going in that direction. There is only a pedestrian walk/don't walk indicator that only counts down the numbers when pedestrians are crossing the street. it seemed very treacherous to inch out into traffic and attempt to turn right or left onto Alaskan Way. It is extremely poorly marked, as are several other driveways along the nearby streets. Not the hotel's fault, but very difficult nonetheless. I'm surprised there aren't a lot of accidents out front! There are several good restaurants nearby. Anthony's is right across the street. Try BlueAcre Seafood downtown....just opened. Owned by the same couple that operates Steelhead Diner in the Pike Place Market. Wonderful food and modern light and airy ambiance. There was ONE slightly confusing element to making reservations here: the Marriott website states very plainly that there are no connecting rooms in any price level. That is not the case but you'd never know that from the website and frankly, a couple of people in the on-site reservation department were clueless about this. Thankfully, an alert and talented front desk supervisor helped me out on the phone and blocked out the room reservations for me. We checked in without a hitch! We will definitely return to the Seattle Waterfront Marriot.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to the waterfront, great views”
Reviews.Author: patroo
Reviews.Content: The room was great, and we had a room on the waterfront side, as requested. I really liked the nice bedding. The spa was also acceptable, though not fancy in any way. Resting in a hot tub is a great way to recover after a vigorous day's hiking around the streets. The staff was excellent, the artworks around the lobby were beautiful, and the place was definitely someplace we'd revisit. Parking is close, but expensive, at a paid lot. We parked and left the vehicle in for three days while we walked the waterfront, rode the buses and the monorail, plus took a ferry trip. We noted that traffic downtown dropped greatly on Saturday and Sunday, so it wouldn't have been an issue to drive places that day. Weekdays are pretty busy. I had no idea that downtown Seattle was so steep. It was more like San Francisco in that regard.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel Locations for Cruisers”
Reviews.Author: tmcdonald345
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before our cruise (NCL-Pier 66) to Alaska. Rooms were the usual-very clean and comfortable. Very close to Pike's Market-which was enjoyable. We walked to the Space Needle also...must say that was a bit tougher of a walk, but manageable. Ate dinner at the hotel on the patio. Nice ambiance, food was good, but nothing to write home about. PS..Take the Duck Tour in Seattle...we had a blast!

Reviews.Title: “Yes, We can do that”
Reviews.Author: Flatlanders
Reviews.Content: Cash a $50, extend my stay at the lower weekend rate, get into my room early, park overnight on the street. Sure you can. I don't put too many demands on the hotels I stay in. I kind of slip in and out anonymously on my own business. But this Marriott Waterfront hotel was just right place and right time for my combined business and recreational trip to Seattle. Conveniently located to touristy stuff and a commercial section of town, it is also directly across the street from the conference center in which my event was held. Yet I also rented a car to tour the Kitsap Peninsula and made it back that night, parking free on the street and enjoying the foodie options in the 'hood. The hotel itself was upbeat, quiet, clean and obviously well-managed. I considered this a good value.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: chanchorage
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location. So close to Pikes Market, which is where I wanted to spend my time. We had a great view of the water. The rooms are very clean and spacious. Very nice tv w/ lots of channels. Happy to have a coffee maker and small fridge and plenty of towels. It would be nice if they had free wi fi in the rooms, but relaxing in the nice lobby, using the free internet there, was good enough. The front desk was very nice and eager to help us find good restaurants. Having a small store in the lobby was nice, though paying $3.53 for a bottle of water was not. But that's ok, I was on vacation. I did not eat at the hotel, use the pool, or drive, so this is a short review!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Trendy, and willing to please”
Reviews.Author: tanikir
Reviews.Content: I took my wife here and was quite happy. The rooms are beautiful and the lobby is a good blend of trendy and relaxing. While we had a standard room that didn't have a view, we could still see the waterfront from the side of window. We enjoyed watching the ships go by. This is the only hotel I've stayed in where I loved relaxing in the lobby, so much so, I didn't want to be in the room. We ate breakfast at the hotel's "Bistro 2100 Bar" and the buffet was excellent. Cons: The valet parking is not a good value and the offsite parking is a bit of a walk. I also don't agree with charges for wi-fi as I think that should be a free service for guests. My wife needed some band-aids and while they said they were on there way up, they couldn't find them. It took an hour and a half but they compensated with a free breakfast. Pros: The room itself is an excellent value considering the downtown location. The staff was very friendly and always trying to please. Overall, I'd like to try some other hotels but will probably return as the value is unsurpassed.

Reviews.Title: “Awful service”
Reviews.Author: BastianStockholm
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Seattle Marriott Waterfront eight nights due to a business meeting nearby and was appalled by the ignorant service. After a full day of meetings and dinner with business associates, I expected my room to be ready so that I could work a few hours, prepare for my next day and get some sleep. At least this is what I had expected when I paid $229 per night. On Sunday I realise the the desk lamp doesn't work. Since I know I will work in the evening I ask the next morning to have it repaired by the evening. When I get back at 10pm, the lamp doesn't work and I call the front desk (for the second time) to have it fixed. It takes a person of the staff half an hour and three visits to my room to repair it. The next evening I come back late at 10pm again. This time my room has not been cleaned. It looks like when I left it in the morning including wet towels on the bathroom floor. I go downstairs and request to talk to the manager and place a formal written complaint. It takes the staff half an hour to clean my room, before I can use it again. As compensation for the last two days, the manager offered me complementary breakfasts for the rest of my stay. I usually don't eat breakfast, but I thought it was at least a gesture. But when I bring my little handwritten note (on a business card) to the breakfast restaurant I really had to work hard for receiving my complementary breakfasts. The staff questioned my note and requested to keep it, but what would I show the next day if they took my note? It was also my only proof in case I would have to show something at check out and the breakfasts had appeared on my bill. Hence, instead of enjoying these breakfasts, I had to expain over and over again. After my second breakfast I had had enough and skipped the rest. Since it was a business trip, I didn't select the hotel for the so-called waterfont location, but I understand those that are disappointed by the fact that the hotel is not at all at the waterfront, but squeezed in between a busy road and a noisy railroad. There is no feeling of being close to the water.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely waterfront hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trishymay
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Mariott Waterfront Seattle hotel. The hotel was really beautiful and it was right on the water. We had a small balcony so that we could step outside and enjoy the view. We went to spend a romantic evening and we had a very relaxing and comfortable stay. It was really nice to be right on the Seattle waterfront, and the bed was extremely comfortable. I usually hate hotel beds and I am very picky, but their bed was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Seattle - Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PoodlemaTulsa_OK
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here in early September on our first visit to Seattle, before leaving on an Alaska cruise. We could not have picked a better location for our first Seattle experience. It was right on the water, just a few blocks from the Pike Place Market. A bus stop for the free bus was just across the street, making it really easy to get around town. The room was pleasant - a typical Marriott room - but the lobby included some beautiful blown glass art, and a small store with limited but adequate snacks, coffee, etc. There was also a Starbucks just across the street. Our first night, the concierge made reservations at the restaurant across the street on the water and it was a fabulous meal. I can't say enough good things about the concierge. She was so helpful and even comped us a free appetizer at the restaurant she sent us to. I would definitely stay here again and will be returning to Seattle as soon as I can find a reason to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: JSG07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Seattle for the first time to watch LSU play Washington in their opening game. The Marriot is a great hotel, friendly staff and convenient location to everything! We arrived early on Thursday and expected to have to wait until 4pm to get our room. Fortunately, for us, our room, a belcony room, was available to check in at 10:30am. The room was very clean, the bed is comfortable and having a balcony room was worth the money! I would stay there again if we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Ver nice location - but pricey wifi and amenities”
Reviews.Author: ckilgore
Reviews.Content: A quick trip from the airport, plus, the location in relation to the waterfront and Pike Place Market are great. But amenities like wifi, snacks, etc. are pricey. Overall a nice place to stay if the company is footing the bill.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: globaljunkie
Reviews.Content: Bbooked for 2 nights as it was cheaper than similar hotels for the dates we needed. We were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the hotel and loved the location on the waterfront. We had a room with a small balcony that overlooked the sound. The lift around the corner to the market/shiopping district made getting into town an easy walk and the waterfront location was great for an evening stroll and dinner at the Crab Pot. Would definately look to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty, Not Exciting”
Reviews.Author: 4nRelations_Inexpert
Reviews.Content: This hotel is along the waterfront of Puget Sound to the north of Pike's Market, the ferries, general waterfront activities (several blocks). It is not directly on the waterfront, but across the street and just beyond the trolley tracks. A little off the beaten path. So good for people noise, but you will have to hoof it to all but the aquarium and Anthony's Pier 66. Some rooms have views of the water and may have a balcony (Romeo and Juliette style). Our family had several rooms. Some with 2 queens and some with a king. All were very clean and clean smelling and very nicely decorated with clean, comfy and up to date decor. I think the soaps were bath and body citrusy sorts. Nice. Typical Marriott. Neutral, tasteful - except the bed linens were so incredibly soft. Loved the duvet. I know weird. The staff were very nice and accommodating. They allowed us to check in early (12:30), the bell hop station was unfailingly kind, helpful, fast and efficient and the concierge was helpful. They have an outdoor bar that a few business people seemed to be enjoying while tapping away at their computers. The indoor bar area was deadsville. Some folks mentioned the glass in the lobby. It is, indeed pretty. A blown glass reef. Very nice. Location finer points. You will have to go up hill to most every attraction including Pike's and the mall and most good restaurants, but you are just a small walk to the waterfront action. We were not going on water tours, to the aquarium or to hunt down a tourist tee so we walked up the hill. If you are in town for a sporting event, you will be cabbing it. If you are in town for the opera or symphony and are in heels - cab. The hotel may shake from the trolley. My mom's room was a little closer to the street than ours and she insisted every day that there was an earthquake. I think it was the trolley. I do not have first hand knowledge of the restaurant or room service. This hotel has a concierge room (if not level - unsure) - with another concierge for the hotel in general in the lobby. It has an airline check in/pass kiosk in the lobby (godsend), a little coffee.snack stand, pool and spa. We used the concierge in the lobby. He was very enthusiastic and helpful. I think he would have been game for finding good tickets for your group. I did not notice if there was a spa.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: cheesemonkey42
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel of Labor day weekend. The hotel was VERY busy with LSU Tiger fans in town for the game. But they still attended to out every need for the most part. The good: - Brought bottle opener to our room in like 2 seconds. Other requests were attended to quickly too. - Nice HDTV in room - Good location The Bad: - Had one rude front desk clerk. She seemed put out when asking her for a recommendation for a bar by where we were dining out than evening. - Train comes by and makes noise every so often - Charge for Internet access in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rodrigo187
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful. Great location close to most major Seattle attractions. A little bit expensive but if your comming into town for a few days to enjoy yourself than this is the place to be. Only problem I had was arriving late at night and wanting a cup of coffee. The front desk directed me to the restaurant/bar. When I got to the bar there where about 5 people at the bar and 2 bartenders. 2 people where waiting on their drinks for several minutes whle the bartenders seemed to be chatting with other guest. Finaly after standing there patiently and tired after a long day of traveling the bartender asked what me and my father wanted to drink. I asked if we could have two coffees. He said that they where not serving coffee at this time. ...... what? 1. there was a coffee machine right behind him 2 what bar doesnt have a pot of coffee ready 3 he could have said "it will be a few minutes but i can brew you a pot" Needless to say the restaurant service left a bad taste in my mouth. Now the rooms did have coffee makers but they are the single brew coffee makers and I personaly do not like the quality of the coffee (it taste bland). Pros: Centraly located, Great reception staff, Great Restaurants within walking distance Cons: Restaurant staff

Reviews.Title: “Very Busy Indeed”
Reviews.Author: sjstraveller
Reviews.Content: Sandwiched between a freight railroad and a busy freeway, I found a wake up call unnecessary due to the vibration of rolling trains literally 15 feet from the back of the building. Good views of the waterfront if you are lucky enough to get one of those few rooms, otherwise it's the railroad/freeway view.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but falls short on quality control”
Reviews.Author: giddytraveler
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Waterfront is a gorgeous hotel with a fabulous location. The lobby is incredibly impressive--- a blown glass sculpture adorns a beautiful table in the center---and the front desk staff is totally professional and helpful. We stayed there in June 2009 for combination business/vacation trip. Imagine our surprise when we got up to our room and discovered that the dust ruffles on the beds were dirty and stained---one even had what looked like small blood stains! How gross. But the staff came up and changed them immediately upon request. Room is spacious and comfortable and nicely appointed. Hotel restaurant is unbelievably overpriced for what you get. A regular egg/toast/potatoes breakfast is $14! We went looking for dessert on our first night after having the main meal at a nearby Thai restaurant. We were practically the only ones in the restaurant because by that time it was about 9 p.m. We ordered a single dessert and waited...and waited...and waited. The server literally forgot about us! We asked another server and he brought us the dessert. The original server was barely apologetic! But to the hotel's credit, when we complained, the charge for the dessert was removed from our bill. Very helpful concierge, although she was in a hurry to leave the night we asked her for assistance. But to her credit, she did arrange a dinner reservation for us before she took off. But I do think the hotel has probably the best location in Seattle! Walking distance to the Seattle Aquarium (a very easy, level stroll along the boardwalk), PIke's Market (just a tad challenging on one short street ), Argosy Tours, Elliot's Oyster House and lots of other shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location & Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sarleo
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have stayed at the Alexis and the Edgewater on prior trips. The Edgewater was too expensive for this trip. I booked the Marriot on-line and was worried that I would be disappointed. Was I wrong!! Our stay was wonderful and the price was right and we even got a great water view! We saved money by not renting a car for the 5 days. We walked everywhere-Pike's Place Market, the aquarium, the piers along the waterfront, the restaurants, etc. The rooms were clean and the beds so comfortable. Housekeepers couldn't do enough for us. We were on the Concierge floor-fantastic! There was a hot breakfast and snacks and wine in the afternoon. The Concierge booked us dinner on a Saturday and Sunday night when it was the last minute and all the ships were in. They were very helpful in settting up any activities. Very accessable. There was a Starbucks in the hotel, part of the giftshop, where you could sit outside and eat. Instead, I would recommend getting coffee from the Starbuck across from the front of the hotel. The breakfast buffet on Sunday was worth the money. I have never had better fresh rasberries and blackberries. My only negatives were the pool, which didn't look inviting, but in Seattle you don't see many pools at hotels. Also, the woman at Reception when we arrived at 4am was worse than helpful. I was tired after traveling 28 hrs through airports. But the next day she was gone and the rest of the stay was fantastic. I had a view of the ships, mountains, ferries, the sound and the trains below my room. The room had very good insulation. I could hardly hear the trains as they went by. When I go back to Seattle I will not waste money on the Edgewater. I will definately stay at the Waterfront Marriot and I recommend it highly to all. Happy travels.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - great location!”
Reviews.Author: westcoasttraveler09
Reviews.Content: I'm a little delayed in writing this review. But, I enjoyed my time at the Marriott Waterfront Seattle hotel so much I wanted to be sure I gave it a review. From the moment I arrived, I was cordially greeted both outside the hotel (valet) and inside (front desk). The staff were very pleasant and helpful. What was most pleasant upon arriving was hearing the live piano music not far from the front desk. One night I requested the pianist play the theme song to Charlie Brown... and she obliged. Very nice! The food in their bar/restaurant was exceptional. We ate outside once... and inside once. The service was good, as was the quality of the food. The room did not have an amazing view. But, I wasn't willing to pay for one. haha But, it was very clean and in excellent condition. The swimming pool area was very nice. At least a couple of times we strolled from our side of the hotel to the other side in order to take advantage of the pool, etc. The location is great. It's right across the street from the waterfront. I'm sure that many of the hotel rooms have amazing views. We were able to walk to almost all of the major Seattle attractions. We opted for parking in a nearby parking garage to save some money. Well, parking in Seattle is expensive. A great experience. No complaints! I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “SERVICE WITH A SMILE”
Reviews.Author: smapdi
Reviews.Content: My room was everything I could have hoped for after traveling from the east coast and preparing for a 5 day stay. Strong suits: Sheets: smooth and soft. Bathroom: pristine. Staff: everyone did their jobs with a smile. Location: Walkable to Pike's Place market, excellent variety of dining, aquarium, and shopping Limitations: breakfast room service only; pool area small; In room guest guide is outdated. One note about security: It's limited. Seattle seems to be homeless-friendly, and this hotel has about three street-side entrances. I saw people come in to use the bathrooms in the downstairs conference area. Also saw someone sleeping on the floor. I would recommend the hotel if you can get a group or discount rate. The staff alone overshadowed all of the limitations or hesitations I had. We received a group rate of $225.00 per night. If you rent a car, parking at the hotel is over $30 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: FightOn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent one night at this Marriott prior to departing on a cruise and absolutely loved the hotel. I used points for a free stay and was given a corner room directly overlooking the water (wrap-around windows and a balcony). The hotel is modern, light and airy with a welcoming feel. Location cannot be beat - It is on the water and just below Pike's Place Market (there is an elevator adjacent to the property that will take you up to street level for the Market). As far as complaints about views blocked by cruise ships. There were cruiseliners docked each day, but it is far from an entirely obstructed view and I actually enjoy watching all of the action. I could still see well out into the Sound and had a clear view of Mt. Rainier. My only disappointment was with the on-site restaurant. I believe it had been a Todd English restaurant until he pulled out of his deal with Marriott and they were obviously struggling to re-brand and determine the direction of the restaurant. It was unclear where the entrances was which led to people continuously cutting in line and the host doing absolutely nothing about it. My wife and I actually got up and left after sitting down and taking one look at the overpriced menu and complete lack of any type of breakfast buffet. Despite this, I would absolutely return my next time in Seattle as I assume they will have the kinks worked out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Flyerno.one
Reviews.Content: The Marriott waterfront was not only a nice hotel, but the location in Seattle was really a great asset. The waterfront was across the street, with many stores resturants etc. The elevator at the end of the hotel property took you to the Pike Market with again many shops etc. You could also easily walk to the downtown area from there. The hotel staff was very helpful, and pleasant. You really don't need a car if you are staying local, it is expensive to rent and park in Seattle, gas was also expensive. This location is also near the cruise ship lines and the ferries. We walked to the ferry with no problem.

Reviews.Title: “A real mixed bag at this Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Wiz
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Marriott late on a Monday night, tired after a long flight. I asked if I had a "nice room" and the woman at the desk said, yes, a room with a view of the sound. When I got to the room, with the help of a nice bellman, he assisted me with everything in the room and I glance out the window. All I saw was a big staircase and another building. I jokingly said, some waterview. He said it was a waterview if you looked out the window to the right. Ha. It really didn't matter though. I quickly went to bed exhausted and soon heard a ROARING noise. I thought perhaps it was a large truck outside. A few minutes later, I heard it again. And then a later again. I could not imagine what it was. It sounded like an airplane was IN the room - but I knew we had travelled a distance from the airport. Finally, when I heard it AGAIN, I got out of bed and went to my balcony to see a freight train going by right behind the hotel. Honestly, I cannot believe that no one commented on it before. I can only conclude that maybe there was a soundproofing issue in that room but it was unbearable. To their credit, in the morning, I called early and they moved me to another room - where, BTW, I could still slightly hear the train, but I think I was probably very sensitized to it at that point. So that is the "awful" part of the hotel, Another annoying thing was that I got all suited up in my bathing suit, walked down to the pool, only to find it closed. I do understand that sometimes they need to close things for repair or maintenance - but generally, they tell you at check in, or have something in the room telling you what the alternatives are. For the good things, the service was really good and friendly, the room was quite comfortable with a nice desk and chair, a huge tv, and a very comfortable bed. The food and service in the restaurant was terrific. It was reasonably close to Pike Place Market where you had many food choices. I had breakfast and lunch there most days. There was also a lovely seafood restaurant across the street - I think the name was Anthony 66. The hotel itself was really quite nice, but given that you really go to the hotel to sleep, the noise issue was unbearable. I would not be able to recommend this hotel unless the person would totally DEMAND to be on the front side of the hotel so that they would not have the train noise. Its a shame really.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we only stayed one night!”
Reviews.Author: dmaikui
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review on a hotel, but felt I must on this one. We booked a deluxe king full bay view with balcony. First of all, it was the smallest room I've stayed in, and we travel a lot. The balcony did have a water view but had no chairs to sit on and was 3 x 4 feet only, so don't pay the extra $$. The vending machines for drinks were broken on each floor. The air conditioner fan made noise all night and there were some black hairs left in the tub. Oh, and the bed was horrible. I will stick to the Westin or Fairmont on our next trip to Seattle. We only stayed one night on our way back from awesome Victoria. Anthony's restruarnt across the street from the Marriott was fabu for seafood!

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel. Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: abcdef999
Reviews.Content: Because of cruise traffic, finding a hotel room for this weekend was difficult. Because of this high demand, prices are obviously higher than I would expect. But even though we paid more than I wanted to, this is a great hotel for anyone wanting to be centrally located to all of the sites. It is walking distance to almost everything. It provides very easy access to the waterfront, Pikes market and the shopping district. Rooms were very clean and very quiet. Beds and pillows were great. Also, we used the fitness center and pool - neither are huge but certainly sufficient. Overall, this is a smart, efficient hotel option.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all up to Marriott's customary standards ...”
Reviews.Author: dvgale
Reviews.Content: ...unless, of course, like so many in the service business, they've just given up caring. Checked in Sun. PM for a conference Mon-Fri., very tired, was given a room with a balcony on my request - very nice! On the other hand, the staff misinformed me as to the location of the nearest Walgreen's - the only place, apart from the enormously overpriced and under-provisioned convenience kiosk in the lobby, where you can get some snacks and very basic foods e.g. breakfast, lunch, to stock the in-room refrig - which was definitely a nice feature. Tried to order room service after 9:00 PM (being from NY, I was already up much later than planned) and was told it would be 45 minutes, which I thought was ridiculous, so I canceled my order! I was told the pool was out of service and it remained so for at least the first two days of my stay. On the other hand, the front desk staff were very helpful in directing me to the Seattle Athletic Club, with which they had guest arrangements, for a specially priced visitor pass. (I didn't use the hotel gym, but it appeared - barely - adequate for a cardio-plus-weights exercise regimen for someone traveling and in need of quickly accessible on-site facilities.) Housekeeping were kind enough to give extra towels - but there are no towel bars to hang them! (One hook on the bathroom door and a small bar in the tub - where the shower would get anything hung on it soaking wet - a ridiculous design flaw, to say the least....) On Thursday, I left specific instructions on the door hang tag (as per the hotel guidelines!) for my room to be cleaned by 1:00 PM as the conference would be concluded by then - my room was NEVER cleaned that day! I returned to a dirty room at 2:00, went out for a couple of hours, by 4:00 it was still dirty. Oh - and I tried room service again that evening, and this time they told me it would be at least an HOUR! I told them about my experience Sunday and that they had the slowest room service I'd ever experienced anywhere - and again I canceled my order. (Hate to think how slow the service is in the restaurant!) Two phones in the room, but the one cordless on the desk never worked - why'd they even bother? A monster-sized 42" or 45" LCD TV that seemed to take a year to power up (just like our old tube-type black-and-white Zenith when I was a kid - how nostalgic!). The alarm clock didn't work, I discovered the second day (thankfully the night before I needed it - I woke up on my own that morning and it had never gone off to my recollection, so I tested it - and it failed.) The front desk people had a working one sent to me immediately. A combination alarm clock/radio/CD player with 2 alarms and VERY arcane, hard-to-work controls - bring your own travel alarm with you! I selected this hotel as it was pre-arranged by the conference sponsors, featured a conference-advantaged price, and was located across the street from the conference hall. Any of the rates for this hotel I've otherwise come across on travel sites have been much higher and would be clearly unjustifiable based on my experience. While the front desk staff was most kind and courteous and as helpful as they could be under the circumstances, I'm left with the impression that most of the rest of the staff just do not care about their customers. Having stayed at other Marriotts, Residence Inns, Towne Place, Springhill Suites, etc,, this stay was quite unpleasant by comparison, and I'd look elsewhere for lodgings on future visits to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean, modern and a helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Jangaja
Reviews.Content: I stayed when the hotel was 100% full over a Friday and Saturday night. Online I had booked a room that was supposed to be facing the water and it cost more than the "regular" rate. When we arrived at our room it was facing the elevator/stairs that lead to town. I was not happy! I called and let them know I had booked a room facing the water. They aplogized and asked me to come to the desk to update to a new room. The next room we go to, once again, was NOT facing the water but had a balcony. I was very upset but had to get going to attend the baseball game. I figured I would give up the room with a view and hassle for the regular rate instead at check out. On a note about complaints about a ship being in the way, the only thing I can think of is that perhaps the cruise ships We received the bill under the door and not surprisingly, they charged us the higher rate. We went to the desk and barely had to argue our side of the story. She quickly apologized and gave us an OUTSTANDING lower rate. A rate that was no where to be found online. For that, I give them kudos for fixing their mistake. So if you are booking online and request a room facing the water, be sure to request that upon check in, do not assume you will get it. Other than that, the lobby was simple, yet beautiful. The lobby music was a trendy/ electronica type music that was played too loud for even my 30 year old ears. The rooms were remarkably clean and the TV was great. My complaint about the tv channel selection is there is no Weather Channel and no Fox Sports Network. The bathrooms were spacious and the hot water was immediate and lasted. The room itself was a little more plain than I had expected but comfortable. I was able to pick up wifi on my iPod Touch at times and that was convenient. We only ate one time at the hotel restaurant and that was for breakfast. I ordered the Challah French Toast and it was the best dish I have ever encountered. I'm not usually a consumer of such sweets but was feeling indulgent. It was heaven on a plate! If you have a car with you, be aware that the overnight parking fee is around $35 but well worth it. The valet folk are super friendly and your vehicle is easily accesible. Very much worth the price. I loved the location of the hotel. It was right across from the water and close to shopping and eateries. We walked a lot including to Safeco Field, Pikes Market and the Space Needle. If you don't mind the walking, it's a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “High quality and service”
Reviews.Author: RoadsTakenWillmar_MN
Reviews.Content: The staff remembered us from a previous visit. Our room was upgraded to the concierge level -- great hors d'oeuvre -- and the waterfront views were enjoyable. The fitness room was unusually well equipped. It is easy to walk to the Market and Belltown restaurants or take a cab up and walk down. If you want this location, this is your best choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Sage
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Marriot's; everything was perfect; they even had a breakfast deal. Of course there was that Big Cargo Boat to ruin the view but.... I had a great salmon filet cooked to perfection. The best part was the elevator at the end to bring us to Pike Place Market.

Reviews.Title: “At discount rates, top-notch value for luxurious comfort”
Reviews.Author: Aurora_Guy
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite Seattle hotel and arguably one of the top three Marriotts I would recommend in the USA. It's a popular stop for tourists transiting the cruise ship terminal across the street as well as business travelers seeking a bit of luxury in a great location. Both colorful Pike Street Market and eclectic Belltown are minutes away by foot. Although I have paid full-freight, the Waterfront Marriott becomes a stupendous value at discounted rates. Check for specials. I recently arrived on a chilly February afternoon, but the Marriott hospitality would soon warm me up. The hotel lobby exudes Seattle charm with generous glass sculptures, dreamy trance and jazz, and well-accented furnishings with outstanding lightning. The valet parking staff and bellmen are universally friendly and efficient. Within a day, they knew my name and helped with a special request. The front desk staff were very accommodating, even indulging me while I snapped photos inside one evening. Room furnishings are quite comfortable with luxurious bedding, although I never have cared much for most Marriott computer work areas. You probably know what I mean. The chair and desk arrangements are often uncomfortable. From the 8th floor, I had a nice view of the container ship Kauai docked at the cruise ship terminal. (Others have noted the same, but I have no surprise at seeing a docked ship in a working port.) I could also watch the passenger ferries cross the sound's waters and discharge near the end of Madison Street. The lobby bar is an excellent place to relax or to meet with friends before a night on the town. Bartenders Chris and Cody can banter with the best and bring a smile to a weary traveler, even if just with a great drink. Food-wise, previous travelers may remember Todd English and should know he and Marriott parted ways at the New Year. His Fish Club restaurant no longer occupies one corner of the building. While the restaurant host told me they serve Sunday brunch in the former FIsh Club, most of the dining is done in the side lobby on the street side of the bar. The setting is a bit dark and dreary. The host -- who may have been the manager -- was hardly forthcoming when I asked questions and was the sole staff member who failed to impress me. The waitress, on the other hand, was friendly and attentive, and she answered all my questions about the food and the operations. It seems the dining area will be re-done in the coming months. Grumpy host and darkness aside, the food was simply outstanding, the center of which was a perfectly medium-rare 16 oz NY steak with baby asparagus and rich, creamy potatoes. WIne selections are reasonably priced for a hotel with a wide variety of quality labels. I enjoyed breakfast in the concierge lounge, which has a limited but adequate range, and evening snacks were pretty good. One night I had a Reuben at the bar, and it delivered on satisfying my hunger. You have a million dining options in Seattle, too. Anthony's Pier 66 is across the street, nearby Ivar's, and many flavors of Belltown are a few blocks away. While taxi fares are not inexpensive in Seattle, no place in the downtown district or China Town is very far. Even the baseball and football stadiums are accessible by a long walk or a short cab ride. Swing by for some dim sum before or after a the big game. If you're driving, you can self-park or take advantage of the valet parking ($34/day). For business travelers with meetings in the downtown area, staying here is a no-brainer if on a discounted rate. Ditto for tourists. Check for package rates, including some sports events, as well as weekend specials, particularly during the cooler months.

Reviews.Title: “a place to remember!”
Reviews.Author: solofrequentflyer
Reviews.Content: c/in late afternoon, ofcourse expecting to have my room ready! indeed! a short visit but very nice. great location, good and smart service, staff are friendly. room is beautiful, comfy bed, but only one thing though..not enough bathroom amenities?! overlooking puget sound but there was huge ship blocking the nice view. yet, overall...simply a place to remember!

Reviews.Title: “Great location- a little pricey, but worth it”
Reviews.Author: johnbuk
Reviews.Content: We were taking an Alaskan cruise out of Seattle and needed a place to stay for the night before the cruise. Researched a lot of hotels and went with this one based on location and reputation. It's only a block away (an easy walk) to the cruise terminal from which we departed (although there are two terminals & it wouldn't be as close for you if you were departing from the other terminal). It was more money then we really wanted to spend, but the room we were given at the lowest rate available did have a partial view of the water. It wasn't facing the water, but if you looked out the window to the right, you could see the water. Cleanliness, the size of the room, and the location were all excellent and the staff were all very helpful. We didn't have much time in Seattle, but we hit Pike's Place Market which was only a short walk away, walked around downtown a bit, and had a few drinks after dinner at the Edgewater about a block and a half away. No complaints what-so-ever and it was well worth the money. Would have liked to have stayed there a couple more days.

Reviews.Title: “I was lied to about water view!”
Reviews.Author: Attila_the_Nun
Reviews.Content: When booking this hotel for a very special New Year's Eve stay, I specifically asked for a guaranteed water view, and paid the premium price for one. Upon check in, they acknowledged a water view, but when I went to the room and opened up the curtains, all I could see was this huge container ship right in front of my window! I could not see a drop of water, much less any view of the Sound or the mountains. Surely a mistake had been made, but when I went back down to the front desk, the staff insisted that this was a "water view room," and it wasn't their fault if there was a huge cargo ship there completely blocking the view. They wouldn't let me cancel without forfeiting the entire night's fee, and said they had no other rooms available. There was only one towel in the bathroom, and the room was very small and crowded with the bed and one chair. It sounded like a party was going on overhead, and the noise continued until about 4 am. I have never been more dissatisfied with a hotel. I found the staff to be curt.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tamasutra65
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice now while visiting Seattle on business. It is in a great location right on the waterfront. Walking distance to Pike's Market and many other downtown locations. You can take an elevator just outside the hotel to go up to the next street level (Seattle is hilly). Hotel staff is great. The rooms are nice. Many rooms have water views. The hotel restaurant (Fish Club by Todd English) is very good. I will continue to stay here when I am in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Location makes this place”
Reviews.Author: timidtravelerUs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a rainy Seattle weekend. Very nice waterfromt location. This hotel is great for first time visitors to Seattle.You are only 3 blocks away from the Pike Place Market. That is where I advice going for breakfast or lunch. It is very easy to visit the Market in the early opening hours, before it gets so busy. This hotel is within walking distance of ferry terminals , downtown, and the sculpture park. Very nice location. The staff, especially at the front door were friendly and welcoming. Nice lobby. The beds and linens were great . A nice quiet place. My only complaint - 32 dollar a day parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: travelfunaddicts
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property for a combo business/pleasure trip. Service and amenities were excellent. Attentive, helpful staff, great food even in the business meetings, which is often just so-so. Only negative - hard to see from Alaskan Way so drive carefully.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great - close to everything”
Reviews.Author: MacTexas
Reviews.Content: It has a very different look from a standard Marriot. Location is great for access to the waterfront. There is a railroad that travels on the back side of hte hotel and a main road along the front, so a little challenging getting across the road to the piers and restaurants. Also, the pier for the cruise ships is directly across Alaskan Way in front of the hotel, so when the ships unload, it gets pretty busy. Other than the above, typical Marriot quality and service.

Reviews.Title: “awesome for cruisers”
Reviews.Author: Journey_RN
Reviews.Content: We needed a place near the Bell street Pier for our cruise to Alaska. The Marriott Waterfront was wonderful for location and service! Cannot thank the people there enough for the wonderful hospitality and kindness.
