Traveling with someone in a wheelchair has special challenges, and I think this hotel filled our needs perfectly including delivering a shower chair immediately to our room. Classy and comfortable rooms with beautiful views of the water, and my personal favorite thing in a hotel a great bed and quiet sleeping environment! The bellmen were super!! Each went beyond the call of duty including helping us get to the dock before the cruise and helping us after we arrived back in Seattle after the Cruise. Thank you Men for getting us to the Airport ontime...helping us find a taxi that would meet our needs as well as keeping luggage for us in a safe place until it was time to go. The restaurant, The Fish Club, had a most delicous breakfast omelet I have ever had...far surpassed anything I ever found on the cruise ship. The lobby was beautiful and so comfortable...actually took photos of the glass sculpture prominently featured. A library-like nook with comfortable chairs and books to read. I could move in! Never felt so welcome at a hotel in my life and I have stayed at 5 star places in major cities. I will go back definately. Short walk to the Acquarium, steps from an elevator taking you closer up the hill to the Pike's Place Market (maybe 3 blocks away?), and felt safe, but near so many of Seattle's attractions. Many thanks to all the Seattle Mariott Waterfront employees that helped us! you are the best!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, A Little Isolated from City”
Reviews.Author: dam&gwb
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Waterfront was the last hotel on our 3500-mile driving trip of the western U.S. & Canada. This hotel is on the Seattle waterfront near the passenger ship terminal which would be convenient for people taking cruises out of Seattle. Although both our Marriott Rewards guest profile and our Expedia reservation requested a quiet location away from elevators and ice machines, which the front desk staff acknowledged at check-in, we were initially assigned to a room next to the elevator lobby. With profuse apologies from a different front desk person, we were reassigned to Room 505 which was near the end of a very long L-shaped hallway. It overlooks the auto entrance below and a Starbucks across the way. The room was nicely furnished with a wonderful flat-screen, hi-def TV (great for watching the Olympics from Beijing) and very comfortable beds. The bathroom had excellent counterspace and except for one day when no clean bath towels were provided the housekeeping was excellent. The staff on the front door was friendly and efficient, our car was almost always there when we called for it, and the doorman was always eager to offer directions. We found the waterfront area a little isolated from the rest of the city. It is at the bottom of a cliff-like hill with a railroad track running behind the hotel and an old expressway above it (there was virtually no noise from either). Pike Place Market is on top of the hill which is either a very long stairway up or an elevator ride up from the passenger ship terminal or a circuitous drive to reach.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful VIew and great overall experience”
Reviews.Author: wolfsburg2
Reviews.Content: I Stayed at the Seattle Marriot Waterfront from July 9-18 for work. The hotel is right on the bay and the views are pretty amazing. You are walking distance to everything. Only a mile or so to the M's and Seahawks stadiums, the SPace Needle etc. The food in the city was imo not great. I didn't eat at the Hotel restaurant, The Fish Club by Todd English, while there but did have room service. Room service was average or slightly above, nothing to write home about. The room was great, very clean, roomy, nice bathroom. The hotel is very nice. Ultra Modern, a nice lobby bar overall a pretty hip spot.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful spot on the waterfront!”
Reviews.Author: AlyshaSeattle
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here on the Fourth of July. In fact we specifically stayed there on the 4th so our family could watch the Elliot Bay firework display. We were upgraded to a corner room, which was lovely. It even had a small balcony to catch a breath of sea air. It was a king room with plenty of space for our family of 4. We had a bed brought in for our 8 year old daughter and it fit snugly against the balcony door side of the room. There was also a small desk, plush chair and ottoman and bureau that had on top a flat screen TV (that I would consider too large for the room but husband and daughter thought it was great). Very, very clean. Super bed. The view of the small marina and West Seattle was right in front of us and such a spectacular look at the Olympic Mountains beyond. You can watch the ferries come and go. And of course watch the fireworks to the North later that night. Lovely lobby. Small bar area. WONDERFUL piano player that evening who was SO sweet and played a few Disney themed songs for our two kids. They were entranced. VERY small indoor/outdoor pool. Just one depth and doesn't fit many people but it was nicely heated. Hot-tub/spa was under repairs when we were there so it was non-operational. We used room service for breakfast in the morning which was prompt and accurate and hot and very good. Another note, we were upgraded for our room because we had originally booked a concierge level room. They must have been overbooked. So we were in a better room but on a different floor than the concierge room, which was fine, but each time we went up to the concierge room, there was NEVER any snacks or beverages out (except coffee & tea). Not exactly what I expected. So we paid extra for something we didn't get to use, but did receive a better room than we booked. So in the end I guess it evened out. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This is a fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: phonia33
Reviews.Content: Just went to Seattle for the first time and got hotel recommendations from a friend of a friend who lives there. This hotel is right on the Puget Sound and is spotlessly clean, with an amazing staff. We travel frequently and I have to say these folks surpassed all expectations! We paid a bit extra for a waterfront view and was definitely worth it. A short walk uphill and we were in the middle of the Pike Street Market with lots of great shops and restaurants. A few short blocks away was Pioneer Square with much more shopping, clubs and restaurants. Right in front of our hotel was the waterfront, with yachts and touristy restaurants intermingled. Parking was a bit pricey at $32 a night and this hotel is not inexpensive - but the comfort, amenities, location, ambience and service made it our favorite of our Pacific Northwest trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything Marriott”
Reviews.Author: kansas71
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 3 nights at the Waterfront Marriott. Everything was great, couldnt find anything to complain about. Thought the price was compareable for Seattle hotels. The view was amazing. We had a corner unit with two balconies. We loved every minute of the stay. Loved watching the cruise ships come and go. The room was really nice and was surprised it was so big.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! You have got to stay at the Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: cobaltgirl
Reviews.Content: The location is wonderful. You can walk to the marketplace or downtown. We had a beautiful view from our window of the water. If you plan on cruising, the Celebrity docks right in front of the hotel. The staff walked our bags across the street with us. The room was delicious. Everything you could possibly want. Wonderful beds, turn down service, chocolates, daily paper and more. We spent 5 days here before we took a 7 day cruise to Alaska on the Celebrity. We had fresh cut flowers from the marketplace sent to our room for $10. Pay the extra for the concierge floors (7 & 8) as the breakfasts, daily snacks and drinks will save you money. They keep the frig in the dining area stocked with water and sodas for the taking and we took advantage of it. Plus the view while you eat is great. I can't think of a thing we didn't like. The staff was very accomodating and the lounge was wonderful. June, the pianist, is worth listening to as you sip your favorite drink and snack on appetizers. The hotel is beautiful, We visited the indoor pool and gym but didn't have time to take advantage of it. There was too much to do in town. Hidden Tips: Eat at the Pink Door. It is hidden in an alley but it was recommended by Frommers and we loved it. You can walk there. Also, rent a car for a day $35, and drive over on the ferries and go to Deception Pass. Absolutely breathtaking!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: JKTexas
Reviews.Content: I thought would add some comments here since the reviews here go both ways. Location: This hotel is in a good location - right on the water front as the name implies, and a quick 5-10 minute walk to Pikes market. You do have to take an elevator or stairs and then walk up a block or 2, but no big deal. I think being below Pikes Market, and on the water-front gives you quick, convenient access to 2 of the great features Seattle has to offer. (Tip: Check out the park at the end of the street -- to the north of the hotel - it is a very nice park!) Hotel: Nicely decorated. Concierge floor has very nice views. The salmon offered in the morning was a very nice touch. Parking is steep but all parking in the area is high priced and the valets have to make some money. The only negative I have is that the rooms were a little smaller than a normal Marriott - not that big of a deal if you don't spend much time in the room. Other than that, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “what to expect ...”
Reviews.Author: _de_last_one
Reviews.Content: Location - if u happen to be going on a cruise, this would be the hotel for you as the terminal is directly across (which for other travelers, when the ships are leaving, u will hear the loud horn) The property is U-shaped but all rooms have a balcony. The view isnt that great as u r blocked by the terminal but if u r on the right side of the building, u get a view of the mountain. There is a lift to bring u up 3 levels towards Pike Place Market. This lift is located outside the property (about a min. walk or so). Not that great of a walk back at night (wondering souls hang out at this landing). Check in - very professional looking staff, young and efficient though the concierge seemed to be very busy at all times (missing most of the time and usually a bit of a wait to see her). Lobby is of the new age Marriott, very hip and trendy (at night, this lobby bar area is very packed and noisy for the whole week we were staying) Room - usual Marriott standard (see photo attached), was hoping the bathrooms will have a shower rather than a tub Facilities - small city gym, small pool (half in and half out), if u hang out on the deck, those walking along the bridge or taking the lift to pike place will be watching as it is directly beside the elevator/link to Pike. There is a tiny room where u can use the internet (complimentary) but with only 2 units, it is always occupied Overall, within expectations of an older Marriott that had been updated.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special for the $$$”
Reviews.Author: Bexthreekids
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from our Seattle vacation and our last night was spent at the Marriott, based largely in part because of other members' recommendations. While the hotel itself was okay, we expected more, especially since we'd just stayed in another really lovely hotel in Seattle earlier in the week for less money. I tend to be pretty particular about hotels, but can forgive certain things if the place is clean. We noticed that the towels had a funky odor to them, which was kind of nasty, and that the bathroom wasn't as clean as I would have hoped for. Also, when we made the reservations, we were informed that our breakfast would be included in the price of the room, which was a nice bonus. However, upon checking in and being told that we'd been given a room on the concierge level, we learned that whatever amenities came with the concierge level didn't extend into past Thursday...and we happened to be staying over on a Friday. Kind of a bummer. Also, the hotel info book in our room listed the hours that breakfast is served, and from that, we learned that our free continental breakfast wasn't offered on the weekend. My husband happened to wander down to the concierge lounge this morning, just to see what was happening, and lo and behold - we'd just missed the breakfast that wasn't supposed to be happening. Oh, well. On the plus side, we were very close to Pike Market - just a short walk from the elevator and then another couple of blocks to the market itself. The bellhops were attentive and offered us water every time we left the building and we were able to secure a taxi back to the airport in a matter of seconds. It was a decent hotel, but for nearly $400 for one night, I would have expected much more.

Reviews.Title: “good experience”
Reviews.Author: Wilross3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights with our 4 and 6 year old kids. They had no problem going "up the hill" to Pike Place Market. There were some great restaurants nearby, and it was very convenient to the cruise ship terminal. We carried our luggage across the street. Really no big problems at all - kids loved the pool, lobby was nice, breakfast was expensive for a buffet, so we walked to Pike Place. Concierge was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Yea and YES”
Reviews.Author: lovinlife421
Reviews.Content: I stay here often, as in every month or so. I am either with children and a nanny in a suite which is ultimately luxe or I stay in a single room because I am adjacent to night life but without the noise. BAR staff is top of the line. Brown haired barmaid is always at your service and food is great no matter what the hour. Keep in mind I love this place with 2 boys under the age of 6, or with my husband, or sans any accompaniment at all.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Waterfront.....Yes & No”
Reviews.Author: loverofreviews
Reviews.Content: After researching and reading reviews for this property, for the most part, I felt accounts were accurate. On the other hand, for those seeking a realistic account of this property, please read on. 1. Good location if: You are departing/arriving for an Alaskan cruise, interested in exploring Belltown, love being in a "wharf" type atmosphere. 2. Previous accounts and hotel website act as if Pike Place Market is merely an elevator lift away.....not exactly. You have a bit of a walk (uphill) so keep it mind if you have a elderly guest or child in your party. (We did not, but as a mother of two small ones, I could imagine the hike would have been an issue.) 3. We were guests of an upgraded room with a balcony (#674) We did indeed have a more spacious balcony than others, but with that "perk" came a consistant group of drunken, foul mouthed local (perhaps homeless) individuals peering directly into our room from the elevator leading to Pike Place. So, with the audience, we didn't spend much time on the balcony. 4. On a good note: Friendly staff as you would always expect at our beloved Marriott. 5. My local favorites: Metropolitan Grill if you are looking for a special night. Just know going in $$$$$ Belltown Pizza has a jerk of a bartender (possibly owner) but sweet waitress & amazing pizza (very close to Marriott) 88 Keys is a dueling piano bar in Pioneer Square (easy walk if your tipsy) and tons of fun. Salish Lodge is great for a massage!!!!! Red Hook & Chatuea St Michelle in Woodenville make for an easy daytrip....beautiful drive. Have fun in this wonderful city :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel But A Bit Expensive For What You Get”
Reviews.Author: taralynn86
Reviews.Content: The Marriott was beautiful from the moment you stepped in the lobby. The front desk staff was extremely kind and helpful. However, the concierge desk was empty 5 out of six times that I walked by over two days. Finally there was someone there but her phone was rining off the wall and she wasn't very helpful due to how busy she was. The room was spacious and clean. We had a balcony. It was small but it was very nice to be able to open the door and get some fresh air! We had drinks in the lobby bar both nights. They were delicious and priced reasonably. They are only open for a few hours in the early evening though. We did order room service one morning. The food was delivered right on time and it was nice and hot! The Hotel is in a great location for shopping and sight seeing. To get to Pike's Market and to the shopping district you do have to walk up a steep hill, but the hotel does have a street elevator that takes you up part of it. This is a great place to stay before or after a cruise since it is directly across from the cruise port! I would definitely stay here again if the rate was a bit lower. We paid $250.00 per night and I felt that was a bit high for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rebekajean
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a night before our cruise to Alaska. Beautiful hotel, great location for access to our cruise ship and for seeing Seattle waterfront area. Just steps away from Pike Place Market and all the sights along the waterfront. Walk or take the free trollys to lots of area sights including the Space Needle. We made reservations months in advance so the price was reasonable (under $300.00 per night for Concierge level which included breakfast, snacks and evening wine and cheese). Wonderful friendly and accomodating service, really yummy apples at the front desk, we enjoyed all the perks of this beautiful hotel. Our room could have had a nicer view but we were gone except to sleep. The train runs along the back of the hotel but the noise was faint. There wasn't enough wrong to keep us from staying again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing really to complain about”
Reviews.Author: Floella-Flower
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel whilst on a business trip. The location was ideal - plenty of restaurants nearby, the market and downtown Seattle is no more than a few minutes (and fortunately one lift) away. The hotel restaurant, although on the high side of the price window is excellent - had by far my best Clam Chowder there. The hotel itself is not the cheapest but you get what you pay for, staff were excellent, rooms spotless and very comfortable, the bar and restaurant equally relaxing and room service without fault. I shall be returning soon and will have no issue with using this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Mully516
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently celebrated our 10th anniversary with a 4 day stay in Seattle at the Waterfront Marriott. I cannot say enough good things about our time there. With the help of the wonderful concierge Margo, my husband was able to surprise me by having local cheese and wine waiting in our room on arrival; on her own, Margo had added some chocolate and a lovely bouquet. Margo also arranged reservations for two fantastic dinners (Palisade and the Waterfront Seafood Grill) during our time there. The staff--from the front desk to housekeeping to valets--were all extremely courteous and attentive. Our view, which looked out on Elliott Bay, was magnificent, and the room was very clean, quiet, and comfortable. I enjoyed the modern decor of the hotel. Very convenient location, just down from Pike's Place and right across from a free shuttle that goes to Pioneer Square. We had a perfectly wonderful stay and look forward to returning sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Waterfront Seattle, a good Choice”
Reviews.Author: ItraveltoItaly
Reviews.Content: Stay one night on points, before flying out of SEATAC on a mid day flight. Very nice hotel which is close to the Pike's Place area and shopping. Norstrom rack is just 2 or so streets above the hotel. The rooms are very nice and the beds are very comfortable. They have a Starbucks right off the lobby and another one acrross the enterance way to the hotel. Park in the World Trrade Center above and to the left of the hotel, it is much cheaper than the valet parking. Nice location and good eats across the street at the Bell Street Dinner, you get Anthony's Homeport food at a much cheaper price. Also great views of Elliott Bay.

Reviews.Title: “An Ideal Location with an Ideal Staff”
Reviews.Author: caidy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all and more than what I had hoped. When we arrived I felt that the room we initially booked was a bit too small and we were immediately given a suite with an extraordinary 180 degree view of Elliot Bay and Puget Sound. The staff was extremely helpful although ironically the concierge seemed a bit immature for her profession. I must add that the restaurant, The Fish Club, was wonderful. Cuisine that I would expect at more exclusive eateries. I would also recommend this hotel for those wishing to be close to the Pike's Market as it is just an elevator ride away. Altogether a wonderful visit. It is clean and quiet as well despite, the weekend we were there, loaded with children.

Reviews.Title: “newish and clean”
Reviews.Author: MarenOC
Reviews.Content: I stayed here just one night for a meeting. The lobby was obviously decorated in a new style and I was told the property is 4 years old. I asked for a room with a view on check in, and they did their best to accomodate me as it was only 11am. My room had a "balcony"-smallest I ever saw-about 5'x5'- I would more properly call it a "viewing platform". My direct view was of the other wing of the hotel,but off to the side I could see the bay. The room had a digital thermostat which I always appreciate. Typical new Marriott comfortable bed with down bedding, nice Bath and Body Works toiletries. My only complaint was the room was poorly lit and desperately needed a desk lamp. If I had been staying longer, I would have asked if I could get another lamp. Internet worked well and although it was $10/day, I have paid more at other properties. The hotel is immediately adjacent to rail road tracks and I had been warned by locals that the trains may keep me up all night. I actually found the room to be very quiet. I would not hesitate to stay here again. Had a great dinner directly across the street at Anthonys.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Philch1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business, and my first thought was that the room was over-priced. It was a lovely room, with a comfortable bed and ocean view. Housekeeping were good and kept the room very clean during my 5 night stay. The telly was large, but not flat-screen. No bath robe was provided. The location is great - you can walk to the market and all the big name shops. The monorail station is walking distance, and I think it is not too far to walk to the space needle either, although I did not try. However, this was the first hotel I have stayed in which does not have a mini-bar or a safe. There is a fridge, but only for your own food and drink purchased outside the hotel. Food from room-service was delicious, but again I thought it was expensive. I had a very pleasant stay, and would be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure about this one, more on my part than the Marriott's”
Reviews.Author: SophieG1
Reviews.Content: Not sure about this one because I suppose much depends on what you expect from Seattle. We had a very limited time there, less than 24 hours. Reception staff were thin on the ground. It took 15 mins to get to the front of check in (and we are elite members). I had expected more of the waterfront area. Of course it was winter and rather grey and gloomy as one would expect for Seattle at this time of year, but the waterfront (in case you don't know) is very industrial with big freight ships and a railway track nearby. To be fair I had not done my research, as we were staying such a short time to catch a flight back to London, but I don't think I would be in a rush to return. The hotel has adequate room service and the staff do seem willing to please. There is quite a nice (small) pool area which goes outside, so is part in and part out, which the kids liked. The bar menu is very limited, but they are willing to serve options from the fish restaurant attached to the hotel in the bar. At 3p.m. it was not possible to obtain bar or restaurant service, and we were referred to room service (but we had already checked out, and to be honest wanted a meal in a bar/restaurant,) but as a special request, the fish restaurant would serve us a late lunch (they did not open for dinner until 4p.m.), this was a rather nice touch and the staff were friendly and helpful. Our fellow travellers had difficulties with a less than perfectly clean room, but ours was fine, very clean and the Marriott bed was as usual lovely. At the time we stayed in early January, the area felt a little deserted, but may have more atmosphere at other times of the year. It reminded us of a rather jaded English seaside resort, but with more of a big city edge. Limited experience with the locals, and the mounted police (the kids wanted to stroke the horse) was very positive. There is a handy lift from the waterfront area up to Pike Place (the market) if you turn left out of the hotel past the fish restaurant you should find it on the left. Not sure how I would feel about walking around in this area late at night though, if necessary I would perhaps check with a local. It may feel better at a busier time of year. In all the Marriott did feel homely when we were in a completely new place for such a short time.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, comfortable place”
Reviews.Author: DougCG
Reviews.Content: We stayed here using a voucher but certainly weren't treated as "coupon" customers. Nice, helpful staff, clean, comfortable rooms. Don't miss the indoor/outdoor pool, which was great even in October. Our voucher included breakfast buffets at the Todd English restaurant downstairs, which filled us up well into the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Seattle Marriott Waterfront -- Gorgeous and Accomdating”
Reviews.Author: SmrtBloned
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms at the Seattle Marriott Waterfront and the service and rooms were superb. Fantastic location, incredibly accomdating staff (even with a two year old)...fabulous. Definintely one of the best Marriott's I've stayed in, and I've stayed in my share. Would defnintely go back.

Reviews.Title: “AS BAD AS IT GETS....”
Reviews.Author: drgene
Reviews.Content: My one night at this hotel- which cost almost $1000.00- was as bad an experience as I have ever encountered at a Marriott Hotel. While very pleasant, management was totally ineffective at resolving any of the issues brought to their attention. The General Manager particularly seemed ill at ease in the hotel and avoided guests and their feedback. Despite three calls to the hotel's Room Dvisions Manager prior to our arrival, our assigned room was not in any way what had been both promised and guaranteed. Food in the Tood English restaurant was barely edible. Service was spot on, but one wishes the food would have been up to this Chef's capabilities. Every department- from Room Service to Housekeeping- managed to repeatedly provide service of the lowest standard. An absolute disaster!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay at the Marriott Waterfront”
Reviews.Author: GB4469
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a wonderful location. As the name implies, it is situated on the waterfront. The lobby is lovely and spacious. It has a nice bank of elevators which resulted in us never having to wait. Our room had a small balcony with a delightful view overlooking the bay. The room was light and airy. The room had a small refrigerator, which we prefer, rather than the overpriced "honor bar" one usually finds. There were only three dresser drawers, which was a drawback for us as we were staying for several days. The bathroom had adequate space with nice granite countertops. However, shower caps were not part of the amenities and one had to be requested. Surprising for a hotel in this price range. The beds were quite comfortable. Room service was tasty, but slow. We were advised the wait would be between 30-40 minutes and it was actually about an hour. Newspapers were delivered to our door each morning, even on weekends. The hotel is within walking distance of the Pike Place Market and the wonderful downtown Seattle shopping. However, many of the streets are quite steep, so wear good walking shoes. There is a Starbucks in the hotel as well as directly across the plaza. In addition to the hotel restaurant, there are several restaurants within easy walking distance. There are only two options for parking: Hotel valet parking for a flat daily fee of $32 plus taxes or a parking garage next to the hotel that is not associated with the hotel. For this parking, one has to pay each time one leaves the parking lot; therefore, it would be cost effective only if one left once a day. We used the hotel parking and, while it was not cheap, we never had to wait on our vehicle after calling for it before leaving our room. The hotel staff was always courteous, friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our stay and would certainly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not worth what you pay”
Reviews.Author: moose19
Reviews.Content: We were in Washington and Oregon for a week, and this was the most we paid for a room and the least satisfied we were. To be fair, the location of this hotel is fantastic and the staff was friendly. Unfortunately though, that's where it ends. We were paying close to $300 a night for our room and did not feel like it was worth it at all. Here are my specific complaints: 1. Our confirmation said we would have a "spectacular view of Elliott Bay." We were able to see the bay, I'll give them that. Spectacular would be overstating it, though. If we stood in one of the corners of the room right up against the window and looked off to the side, we could see the water over top of a couple of parking garages. Spectacular? Not really. This alone would not have been enough to make me complain though since we don't really spend a lot of time in our room. 2. The bed was not comfortable AT ALL. I usually like Marriott beds and think they're very comfy. This one was awful. I read another review saying they felt like they were bouncing around all night any time their spouse moved. Yup, I'll agree with that. I don't really have back problems, but by the end of our 3-night stay my back was killing me and I really hadn't slept well because of all the bouncing around. 3. The third morning of my trip, the shower was ice cold. This was the last straw for me. $300 a night for a cold shower? Really??? At this point I filled out a comment card for the manager. I would have called and talked to someone directly but we were in a hurry to get on the road and my husband didn't want me to take the time. I was very specific on the comment card and left all my contact info hoping for something in response, and I have heard absolutely nothing in response to my complaints which makes me cranky. I may still call although I don't know what I would expect to happen at this point. To sum up, the location was really great and for that reason I could give it 2 stars instead of 1. Otherwise I felt like it was a total rip. One more tip: I wouldn't really advise paying a lot of extra money for the concierge level unless you get a good deal and it's not too much more than a regular room. You get free breakfast which is always nice, but it's basically bread stuff (cereal, muffins, etc) and scrambled eggs and bacon. It's the same thing every morning. They have free muchies in the afternoon and you can buy drinks, but the drinks are just as overpriced as they would be in a bar. So it was nice enough and all, but not worth a whole lot of extra money. . \

Reviews.Title: “Marriott's a lifesaver.”
Reviews.Author: toodycat
Reviews.Content: We were booked at the Fairmont in Seattle for one night before an Alaskan cruise. We arrived at 1 am. to find that in spite of our calling to confirm arrangements earlier in the day, there were no rooms left, except a double smoking suite. Since there were three of us who were non-smokers with allergies, we could not use that room. Fairmont had their driver take us to the Seattle Marriott Waterfront instead. This inconvenience was a blessing in disguise. The Marriott is situated right near Pike's Market and the Seattle aquarium. The lobby is beautiful. It has a multi-colored carpet and an amazing display of Murano glass (Rumor has it the carpet alone cost $250,000.) One sitting area has a fireplace. Soothing music plays in the background. The manager at the desk welcomed us warmly, accepted our transfer letter from the Fairmont with no question and put us in a non-smoking room with sufficient space for the 3 of us. (Actually, the entire hotel is non-smoking. )The room itself was comfortable, but not exceptional in terms of decor. It looked like a typical business hotel room. The toiletries were a very nice citrus scent from Bath and Body Works. We ordered cereal and milk from room service. It was outrageously priced, but at 2 a.m. we were not in a position to haggle. It did arrive promptly and the people who handled the transaction and delivered the food were very friendly. The next day we were able to tour Pike's Market, have breakfast at Lowell's and see the Seattle Aquarium. Both were only steps away from the Marriott and hotel employees were more than helpful in terms of recommendations and directions. Walking along the waterfront was a pleasant experience, too. To conclude, even though this was not the hotel we intended to stay at, it was a lovely experience and when I return to Seattle, I will stay there again,

Reviews.Title: “Cheesey and not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Neil-from-Dallas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two days in August and were not impressed! It is well located on the waterfront right across from were the huge cruise ships come in and there is an elevator that takes you up to Pikes market whcih was celebrating 100 year aniversary so that and the great weather made up for some of what the hotel lacked. We stayed on the club level and there is a cheesey room where there are cheap snacks as in small bags of potao chips and other delicacies. The room was clean but the toilet was like something out of a public restroom and it made a sound like a jet taking off when flushed. There are small balconies that you can barely stand on. But what is really amazing is that there is a train that runs by the hotel several times a day with all of the associated noise that you can expect from a frieght train! Also, when we took the elevator back from the Pikes market at night we thought that we would be killed becasue there are some very unsavofy charecters hanging around! There is better for the money! So unless you enjoy staying on the other side of the tracks for $350 a night, don't bother with this paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Champagne77007
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott Waterfront Seattle over the forth of July holiday. The room we occupied faced the water, and it was your typical Marriott room. The room was clean, as was the bathroom. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. Brunch at the restaurant was a bit pricey, but worth every penny. This hotel is in a good location. It was our first time to Seattle and we were able to walk to all the sites we wished to see. Yes, you do have to walk up a hill to reach the market, but there is an outdoor elevator that will take you up about 1/2 way up the hill. The rest of the hill was steep to us, but we live in a flat part of the country so I am sure that the steepness was a relative concept. Like other reviewers, we cashed in our Marriott points to stay in this hotel and were treated exceptionally well by any standards. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of My Best Marriott Stays”
Reviews.Author: LoveParisNotHilton
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at the Marrriott Waterfront Seattle using Marriott Rewards point. Often when using Marriott Points I have been given less than desirable rooms, this was not the case at the Marriott Waterfront Seattle hotel. This was an absolutely perfect stay at a beautiful hotel. The room was very clean and comfortable with a small balcony providing a waterfront view. The location is perfect for waterfront activities as well as visiting the Pike Place Market. Walk out the front door and a Starbucks is right across the entrance from the hotel. I can't say enough about the professional and friendly service we received from every staff person we encountered during our stay. Marriott Waterfront Seattle - thank you for a most enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great View and Location”
Reviews.Author: markdunn
Reviews.Content: Staying on the waterfront is terrific. The view was great. We had a balcony and spent time watching the watercraft of all sizes. There was also a concert accross the street. The hotel is close to Pike's Market--an easy walk. The Marriott beds are so comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: fbkryan
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice...lots of space. The location is also good. Cruise ships dock right in front of it so it was fun to see which one was in port. The only negative I experienced was the front desk staff was not the most informative.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Room, Service and Location!”
Reviews.Author: rose2nomad
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the Waterfront Marriott, check-in was seamless. I had requested a room closeby the elevator, and not only was it ideally located, the room I was placed in was wonderful. I had a corner room with two balconies and an amazing view of the beautiful waterfront and Mt. Rainier in the distance. The room was clean and comfortable. I ordered room service a couple of times and the orders arrived promptly. The Marriott employees were all pleasant and helpful to talk with. As for location - it couldn't be better. The waterfront restaurants and stores were all within walking distance. The double decker bus was located right across the street and stopped by twice an hour. Unfortunately, I didn't get a chance to go up to Pike Market through the elevator connected to the Marriott, but that alone was handy. And if you were to walk to the Space Needle, it would be a leisurely 20-25 min. walk or a quick 5 min. taxi ride (approx. $6). My stay at the Marriott was for 3 nights, 4 days and although I was there for business, it definitely felt like a quick vacation. Should I have the opportuntiy to come back again, I would love to stay at this particular hotel purely for its convenience and lovely experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, area and great views....a few minor problems.”
Reviews.Author: Alaskacouple
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel on the waterway and next to the railroad tracks. The views are great of the harbor, neighbor’s room or the stairs to the market. The rooms are nice and clean. Unfortunately, the bathroom is a little on the small side and does not have a fan. The location is great and you can get around down town easy and safely. The pool is small and shaded during the day. This is the only place you hear and see the trains that run all time. If one, pass by just plan on kissing your mate, because talking is impossible. The staff is the tops and friendly. Suggestions: 1) is to use public transportation from the airport, it fast, efficient, inexpensive, easy and droppes you a few blocks away. 2) At night, a unsavory crowd hangs out at the elevator/stairs going up to market. It seems to regularly patrol by police and security. So, just be aware if traveling alone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Marriott, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: adrincali
Reviews.Content: This is a really beautiful hotel. The bed linens and the bed were absolutely heavenly! It is right on the water and just up the hill is the famous Pike's Market. There is a Starbucks right next door to the hotel. Excellent downtown location, tons of shopping (Macy's, Nordstroms, Nordstroms Rack, etc) nearby as well as wonderful restaurants. You should also check out Ohana's on 1st Ave, which is an excellent sushi restaurant/tiki bar (about a 7 min walk from hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: jpram
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at the Marriott Waterfront and couldn’t have been happier with this choice for location. I would definitely recommend this property for a Seattle visit. The hotel is one of a few that are right on the water offering up close views of the Sound. Pike Place market is literally a few blocks away (the elevator takes you up the hill). There are many restaurants along the waterfront and also near the Market within walking distance. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful – from the bellhops, to the front desk, to the concierge. The concierge was a great help in recommending activities and restaurants. The concierge floor was nice for breakfast/snacks. Activities - The concierge recommended a great place to rent kayaks on Lake Union. The free tours at top of Space Needle are very informative and worth the price of admission to the top. I would not recommend the Double Decker tour bus. It wasn’t really that informative. Ivar’s and Pink Door were our 2 favorite meals. Ferry to Bainbridge was nice, but there wasn’t much going on over in Bainbridge on a Sunday afternoon. Try to catch a game at Safeco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: juliebug52
Reviews.Content: I have to give this hotel 5 stars for the service I received. The staff was friendly and accomodatiing. I am a Marriott Silver member and they did give me access to the club floor because they did not have a king bed available, which is my preference.. They do a followup call to see if your room is ok. Little things like that keep me coming back to Marriott properities when I travel. I like the E shape or U shape of the hotel. You do not front the road that runs along the waterfront. Good design. It cuts down on street noise and you can still see the harbor. I love the infinity pool and the beds here. You are not centrally located for downtown but it may not matter depending why you are in Seattle. You are close to Pike's Street Market and if you are cruising this is one of your best choices.

Reviews.Title: “Just look at the water view!”
Reviews.Author: CAStein
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed three weekend nights at this property. Overall the property is up to the chains's standards: clean, good bed, plenty of tv channels, etc. However, this property is not without its quirks. A previous poster mentioned the u-shaped design of the property wherein your view is that of your neighbor's room prompting closure of drapes of all times. This is not technically correct as the hotel is actuially E-shaped, so the chances of getting a room with a view of your neighbor is double! I had one of these rooms the first night and requested an outer-facing room for the remainder of my stay. I received a south-facing room on the seventh floor with a lovely balcony which afforded terrific views to the right of the water. However, looking forward, one's view was of the elevator/stairs to Pike Place Market. This is a much used access and is filled with families, business folks, vacationers and, sometimes, a couple of guys smoking crack (I assume) in broad daylight! I stayed on the concierge floor and can report that the lounge is decently equipped with all-day fruit, soft drinks, coffee and bottled water. Food presentations were unimpressive but tasty. The lounge itself seemed a bit small for the property, easily filled to capacity with guests (and this was a weekend). I saw many guests taking food back to their rooms because of the lack of seating. The lounge staff was intermittantly available but in general courteous and helpful. Some staff seemed less-than-well-versed in local restaurants and/or food quality as I was sent to place "with the best prime rib" that proved to be just about awful. The downstairs concierge seemed more knowlegeable albeit much busier. The hotel restaurant was very good. Staff were knowlegeable, wine selections thoughtful and food very good to excellent. Seems many locals come to enjoy the food and outdoor bar/patio. The waterfront location afforded spectacular views of the Sound and easy access to the cruise, ferry and tourist boat terminals. Also at hand are many trinket stores as well as many seafood restaurants (of which Elliot's is very good). Access to the main town is either via steps or elevators. And then you walk under a highway viaduct (strewn with garbage) and uphill a couple more blocks. So people with below average physical conditioning (or anyone late at night) should consider taking a taxi. Next time in town, I think I'll forgo the lovely view and stay somewhere a bit more centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Marriott hotels around - Seattle Marriott Waterfront”
Reviews.Author: traveldiva10
Reviews.Content: This Marriott goes over and above the call of duty to take care of their customers; they know that you are a repeat (when you have been more than once). They bend over backwards to upgrade your room to a water view, everyone remembers your name, it has a great restaurant on property. They have a wonderful coffeee bar downstairs but also offer Starbucks in every room. Rooms are a little larger than the typical Marriott rooms and very comfortable. Great location if you are taking a cruise also....

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: CSL230
Reviews.Content: We used points to stay memorial day weekend. We arrived at 10AM and they were able to check us into a good waterfront room (it appeared that the hotel was not very full). The staff were pleasant and efficient. The lobby was clean, spacious and had a good bar. We did not eat at any of the on-property restaurants as there are many great choices nearby. The rooms were typical good quality Marriott, and well maintained. The room size was decent for two people. The Concierge desk was very knowledgeable and helpful. The location was great for us - we love to walk and hills are not a big deal. There is an elevator next door to the hotel which goes up from the waterfront to Pike's market, but it was broken for the time we were there. We enjoyed walking to Pike's, around Bell Town (great restaurants, good music clubs.) Favorite restaurants included: Restaurant Zoe, Flying Fish.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT experience!!”
Reviews.Author: hhaywood
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed three nights here...before we got on a cruise. I had no idea that there was a marina across the street from the hotel. We spent many hours just looking at the gorgeous yachts!! Our first afternoon there was one docked that had three decks and a Bell helicopter on the top deck!!! Wow, someone has a LOT of money! The bed/bedding was extremely comfortable!! We didn't eat in the hotel as I had so many restaurant recommendations from tripadvisor to try!! I'm planning on going back same time next year and I'll stay in the Marriott again!! Oh, another note, RCI and NCL use the pier directly across the street from the hotel....and I saw a hotel valet wheeling a cart of luggage down the sidewalk for a couple who were getting on a cruise ship!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Bed!”
Reviews.Author: Chris500
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and convenient to everything, including the markets and shops in the downtown district. The room was comfortable & quiet; it had a nice view and the bed was awesome; very comfortable. Previously, we had requested extra pillows and they had been placed on the bed prior to arrival. Earlier than expected check-in was greeted warmly. The staff were helpful and courteous. A last minute city tour booking was handled with ease. Room service was prompt, although they forgot part of the order and charged us for it. I called and they took the charge off our bill and then unexpectedly brought the remaining dish at no charge. Although booked by internet, we found the hotel through friends. The total cost for the night was $391 USD, which is probably in line for this part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service, location, view. It has it all!”
Reviews.Author: MississippiRenita
Reviews.Content: I used my Marriott points for this stay. Marriott, unlike a lot of other hotels and airlines, treat you the same OR better if you are using your points for your room. Our room was beautiful with a fabulous view of the harbor. The room was beautiful as well. When we arrived, I was telling the front desk about our "horror" story with an airlines. They felt sorry for us, and gave us access to the Concierge Level! The lobby of this hotel is gorgeous. The location couldn't be better. I can't imagine going back to Seattle and not staying here. It just can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Stay”
Reviews.Author: Adam M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while attending a conference at the Bell Harbor conference center across the street. Overall the hotel was fantastic- it has a waterfront location and I was fortunate to have a room overlooking Puget Sound. As an early morning person, I was treated to sunrise views of the ferries and Olympic Mountains. That said, the location isn't the most convenient for first time visitors to Seattle. One one hand, its right on the waterfront and within walking distance to plenty of restaurants. On the other hand, some of the other popular destinations (Pike Place Market, downtown Seattle) are a good uphill walk. The room was very comfortable with a large desk for working. As a business traveler, nothing bothers me more than excessive charges for internet access. The room had a reasonable price for internet ($9.95) and internet access also included unlimited long distance phone calls on a cordless phone (nice touch). Breakfast at The Fish Room restaurant in the hotel was very good (if a little on the pricey side). Hotel staff were all extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: SC/BTravels
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Waterfront is a perfect location. We stayed in a waterfront room on the fifth floor. There is a lot of noise from interior doors slamming and you can hear people talking/yelling in the hallways. At one point we heard hotel security knock next door and ask them to quiet down. The bed was VERY comfy with great linens. Turndown service is provided upon request only. We requested turndown before going out to dinner and when we returned, over 2 and a half hours later, it had not been done. We called "at your service" and someone came, dumped a load of towels on the counter and refilled the TP. No turndown of the bed, empty wastepaper baskets, etc. We stopped at the front desk on our way to the lobby bar to ask if that was the Marriott standard turndown,which the reply was "No." They asked if they could return to the room to complete the service, which they did. We ordered room service the first night there. We placed our tray outside and called "at your service" to tell them they could come and pick it up (this was after 11:00pm). At 9:30am the next morning when we left our room, it was still outside (along with other trays in the hallways). We booked a package that included breakfast at the restaurant. The second morning our food arrived over one half hour after we ordered and it was lukewarm, even more on the cool side. I could understand if the restaurant was busy or had a limited staff, neither of those were a problem. Valet parking does cost. However, they don't mind if you come and go, and were happy to go get your car for you. The Marriott is in a perfect location for walking or driving.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: AColoradoTraveler
Reviews.Content: Great location on the waterfront. Walking distance to Pike Street Market and many great restaurants. The staff is very friendly and helpful. My first choice when in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, good service”
Reviews.Author: David_Miller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple of night recently for business and will be staying 6-8 times a year. The location is very scenic, by the water down town Seattle. Unfortunately everything else is uphill - but there is really only a steep hill to 1st Avenure (two blocks) and the shopping in from around 4th to 7th. 5 mins walking access to the Pike Place Market, surrounding restaurants and bars (check out Kells Irish Bar on Post Alley). The room is spacious and comfortable. I didn't try any of the restaurants, but the fish restaurant looks great and has a good reputation

Reviews.Title: “Love the Marriott!!! "At your service"”
Reviews.Author: EmJoNiCa
Reviews.Content: A very nice Marriott to stay at but they always are! Really comfy beds and nice clean rooms. It is very close to Pike Place Market a quick 5 minute walk and you are there. It is also close to transit and other tourist places like the pier, the aquarium and the ball fields. We walked from our hotel to Pacific Science center and it only took about 20 minutes. (there is a big hill to climb so if you are not into that you may want to take the bus.) The hotel staff are very knowledgable about the area and always willing to help. The restaurant is called the Fish House and is very very good! It is pricey ( $20-$36 US Per Entree) We went once in our week stay as a treat and a treat it was! Wonderful service staff and excellent meal! The breakfast was not included but you could get it from the restaurant meals ranged in price from $10.95-16.95 US. We found it more fun to walk to Pike Place market and go to Lowells or the Athenian for half the price. The only problem we encountered was the valet parking. It is $28US which is a bit more then other garages in the city but you do get in and out priveledges which you do not get at other garages. We were charged for our car as well as someone else's vehicle. The valet staff thought we were trying to scam them and they were demanding we pay! It was pretty good service up until that point. We found out that the valet service is a seperate company that the Marriott hires to do their valet( at this location) Once we got the front desk staff involved they were horrified by the treatment we were getting from the valet staff and they immediately sorted out the problem. The valet staff didnt even apologize for their mistake which we found to be annoying since we did drop a good amount of cash parking our car with them. Other then that small problem everything else was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: jospehine
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Good location, great views, nice staff. I would definitely return. I called shortly after my arrival to inquire about the availability of a product in the hotel sundries store, and was told a complimentary supply would be sent right up. Nice touch. The valets were so nice, making you feel very welcome on your return. More often than not there were two to attend to each arriving vehicle, opening all doors. While waiting for a ride the valet even offered me bottled water. A very nice touch was the airline check-in station, with printer for boarding passes, next to the front door. The restaurant was very nice. The service was impeccable and the food tasty. We had a late night dessert and the buffet breakfast the next morning and both experiences were pleasant. One of the nicest things is the street elevator located just north of the hotel that takes you up from the waterfront to the next street. It's a pretty steep hill. From there it was a short walk to downtown shopping or trendy Belltown. Contrary to rumors that cabs are difficult to find, I had quick success with each attempt to hail a cab. But the downtown bus service is exceptional as well. I was a little worried about hailing a cab after the ballet, so the hotel arranged for a towncar pickup. The driver was waiting for me right on schedule by the front door of the Phelps Center on Mercer, and the price was only a little more than a taxi. I will definitely be staying at this hotel the next time I'm in Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Great For Biz...Probably Better For Relaxation!”
Reviews.Author: klazzy
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a 3-night business trip to Seattle, with virtually all of the time spent across from the hotel at the conference center. This property does an excellent job of justifying what would otherwise be somewhat outrageous rates, given the deals that can be had in SEA. Their staff is very well trained, responsive, and friendly. The check-in was quick and smooth and garnered not only a large corner room, but also a key to the concierge lounge. I spend a lot of time in hotels, both here and abroad, and have never had bedding of the quality that this hotel provided. I even meant to tear the bed apart before leaving so I could read the tags on the sheets! But it was truly their staff that made the few days so pleasant; they are to be congratulated. Even to the point of their valet staff providing me with a bottle of water when I would take the car out. (I guess that is their way of softening the blow of a $28 daily parking charge!) Would I do it again? You bet.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay before cruise”
Reviews.Author: fromArizona
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before going on our cruise. The location was perfect to get to the Celebrity pier. We just walked across the street. The room we were given had a nice view of the bay, and we could see our ship from the room. The room itself was clean and nicely furnished with comfortable bedding. We were able to walk to Pikes Place. The front desk was pleasant. We enjoyed the lobby bar in the evening. It was a nice place to start our cruise vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: emmysmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel because of a trip we had to take to Seattle for his company. We probably would have chosen a similar hotel if we booked ourselves. The hotel is very nice and clean. It is in a great location down on the pier and has a terrific view. The employees are very nice and always have a smile and politely greet you in passing. My only complaint and the reason I didn't give it a 4 or 5 rating is that, in your room when you arrive is a "menu" for breakfast. Supposedly, if you fill it out and put it on your door knob before midnight, the breakfast you choose will be delivered to your room within a time frame specified by you. However, we filled this out and put it on our door knob 2 different times, and never had it picked up or breakfast delivered to us as we requested. The first time, I put it on the doorknob early in the day, because I had a full day planned and didn't know if I would make it back before midnight. When the maid cleaned the room she removed it from the door knob and placed it on the desk in the room. Needless to say, we didn't realize she put it on the desk, so we didn't get breakfast the next morning. How hard could it have been to have left it there? The next night, I put it out at around 11:00pm, and it was still there the next morning. They didn't bother to pick it up. Why offer a service, that you have no intention of providing. I would have thought this was an isolated incident, but a couple of weeks later friends of ours stayed here with the same company, and the same thing happened to them. They actually wanted breakfast delivered 3 days. After the first 2 request were not picked up, they complained to the front desk and at the same time ordered their breakfast for the next morning. When their breakfast was delivered, there were 3 days worth of breakfasts. When they checked out, the front desk tried to charge them for the entire 3 days worth of breakfasts. I probably would stay here again (on my dime), but would order breakfast through the front desk instead of using the door knob card provided in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good - not great”
Reviews.Author: Andaltex
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned from a three night stay. This is a fairly typical Marriott as regards room accomodations, bedding, etc. The location is excellent; it is adjacent to the waterfront and close by Pike Street Market and other downtown activities (wear your walking shoes!). Noise from adjacent rooms (e.g. cell phone rings, loud conversation0 was a definite negative. Also, the room had a noisy ventilation system. We had a second floor room with a limited view of Elliott Bay; be sure to ask for a higher floor. This was an entirely satisfactory hotel, and I'd probably stay here again - but not before searching other spots.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and all round experience”
Reviews.Author: Deano306
Reviews.Content: Wow what a great hotel. Very modern. Hotel had complimentary washer and dryer available on 2nd floor. Our room had a view of the ocean and we didn't have to pay extra for it. You couldn't get any closer to Pike's Market if you tried. Service staff is outstanding very impressive. The indoor outdoor pool and fitness facility is second to none in Seatlle. Truly enjoyed my stay and will be back again in November!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel w/ Ideal waterfront location”
Reviews.Author: LaughingLab
Reviews.Content: Great Marriot hotel. The location is nearly ideal. You're basically on the waterfront, so views from the rooms are great (higher floors obviously better). Also, it's just a short walk to pike place market and downtown (there are stairs/elevetor to get "up" righ next to hotel). Was initially planning on staying at another dt hotel (westin) since it was a little cheaper, but 100% content paying the extra to stay here. The location alone is worth it. Also, the Anthony's trio of places to eat right across the street is nice, have a fish n chips counter, middle range Bell Street Diner, and higher end Anthony's (was very good) all just across the street. Only negatives would be the doors are very loud when shut, try to avoid being next to the maintainence/houskeeping closets as the doors are loud when shut and you likely won't notice this problem. Other downside is the pool is pretty much a waste. It's very small and in a horrible location. If they had put it on the roof and made it an infinity pool... I'd given 5 stars, and probably stayed in the pool for the entire trip. Didn't eat at the fish club, but I'd say the same thing, they should have put it 8 floors up and had some of the best views on waterfront... again sure why they didn't.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect setting”
Reviews.Author: Chuck539
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels throughout the Seattle area and this property has become my favorite. The location is terrific with so much of the waterfront and downtown right within walking distance. The views, especially at sunset, are glorious. The staff at this location is extremely helpful and knowledgable regarding the area. The rooms are fairly standard Marriott design but still pleasant. All in all I find this to be the most convenient and comfortable hotel in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great room but questionable value”
Reviews.Author: thedonk
Reviews.Content: Wonderful property and a fine experience. Excellent location. Food should be available in the lobby bar at all daytime hours and not with gaps between regular mealtimes. The room was very nice. The price, however, was high and I have to wonder about value for money here. I would gladly stay at this property again but would probably shop around the downtown area. SAFE TRAVELS - thedonk

Reviews.Title: “Always love a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: boutiquetogo
Reviews.Content: We always love staying at Marriott Hotels Worldwide and this was no exception. The hotel is centrally located on the waterfront,with wonderful views. Loved the room- Marriott feather tops on mattresses, clean and well appointed. Only criticism was not enough towels were left and rooms were serviced so late in the day. Concierge was helpful, but most appreciated were the efforts of the bell staff and doormen who must field thousand of questions a day about directions. Loved this hotel and would not hesitate to go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at this hotel July 5-9, 2006. I loved the location of this hotel because it was right on the waterfront and was so close in walking distance to some nice sights/attractions. Mainly, I adore Pike Place Market, and this hotel allowed me to walk to & from there easily. We also loved the bedding used in the rooms. We did have an unpleasant experience at the get-go when we tried to check in - the clerk speaking with us said the system only showed us as having a reservation for one night, instead of 4 nights! This was a little annoying, but we figured it would be easily solved, so it was more the clerk's attitude that ended up escalating the situation and making us angry. She just kept insisting that whatever the computer said must be right, and did a poor job of handling the situation. It wasn't until the manager, who was standing nearby, came over that the problem was fixed, and then she was able to fix it quickly, and see our enire 4 night reservation. So it was unfortunate that our first impression as we checked into the hotel served to thoroughly anger my husband due to one clerk's attitude/incompetence. Some other semi-negative notes: I only saw a concierge at the desk once during our entire stay, the ATM machine in the hotel charges a fee of $3.25, and the laundry prices are outrageous. There are fortunately free washer & dryer available in the hotel, but be warned that the laundry room consists of 2 small washers and 2 small dryers, so you may have to wait awhile behind others, as I did. The only fee though is $1.00 for a box of detergent or dryer sheets. I wish our room had had a little better view (peek of water in the corner, otherwise view of other buildings & train), but overall I was pleased with this hotel experience. With the exception of the first clerk we encountered, most of the other staff we interacted with were helpful, and I thought the lobby entrance to the hotel, with the sparkling lights in the ceiling, were very pretty. The overall great things were the bedding and the location, right by the water, and close to things I wanted to see and do. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel, Pretty Glass”
Reviews.Author: peachwhit
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. A very quick walk to Pike's Place Market, and even downtown or the Seattle City Center. The hotel appeared to be very new, and everyone, even the visitors staying there seemed friendly. The beds were very comfortable. Our family wished that the hot tub would not have been so small as to only accomodate 4 people at a time. It was the smallest hot tub I have ever seen. I also became disturbed after my husband pointed out the mold growing around the perimeter of the bathroom and coming out of the vent in the bathroom. Everything else about the hotel was fantastic, hopefully they will deal with the mold quickly, which we did mention to the front desk. This was a nice hotel all in all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfortable Rooms, nice restaurant”
Reviews.Author: takelson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 6/21-6/24 2006. This hotel is down on the waterfront, near everything. Our room included 2 doubles with that fabulous Marriott bedding, including a small terrace. The view of the harbor was spectacular. No refrigerator in the room, but one was sent up at no charge. The small pool is "indoor outdoor", partly in the building and partly outside. My eight year old daughter loved it. The Fish Club restaurant was excellent, if a bit pricey. We used Marriott flex anytime awards, which were 25,000 miles per day from American Express. These awards included a great breakfast buffet including smoked salmon and huge prawns. The room rate was about $330 per night, plus about $30.00 worth of breakfast, so the award was very good value. The free #99 bus/streetcar runs in front of the hotel and will take you up to within 3 blocks of the Seattle Center, which includes the Pacific Science Center and Space Needle, and direcly up to Pioneer Square. You can walk to the aquarium, and to the argosy cruise dock. An elevator immediately adjacent to the hotel whisks you up to the Pike Street market area. As another person wrote, park in the Wall street garage, near the World Trade Center East elevator. It takes you up to a walkway and then to an elevator down to street level, a few hundred feet from the hotel. This is $12.00 per day, vs $28 at the hotel. The bell people wil give directions if you ask.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: telleaux
Reviews.Content: Great bartender! Thanks Shari for the fresh squeezed Cosmos.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Seattle Marriott Waterfront”
Reviews.Author: transcona
Reviews.Content: My sister and I recently stayed at the Seattle Marriott Waterfront. It was the most enjoyable experience. We stayed on the conceige level, paid abit more for this room but well worth the money. When we called the conceige line, it was answered prompty and were great with directions and bus schedules. Located along the waterfront it is within walking distance to all pier activities and Pike's Market. We felt very safe walking home from finner cruise at 11 pm. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 days at the Marriott Waterfront. We were there to visit my daughter who is in the Coast Guard. The service was perfect. Our room was clean and the maids went out of their way to please us in every way. The management made a point to speak to us and inquire about our visit. The resturant associated with the hotel had very good food. It was a little pricey but we expected that from Seattle. The only downer I would mention is the parking. Even though we didn't bring a car, our guests had to pay to park in order to visit us in the hotel. The parking was pricey $30.00 daily. Other than that I look forward to a second visit in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfui if your budget allows”
Reviews.Author: mykidssherpa
Reviews.Content: Drop dead views of the Bay, easy walk to Pike's Place and any number of great restaurants and 4 star service. I attended a Microsoft conference held in the hotel. Decided that the $279 was justified as I would have paid any difference in cab fees or parking for a cheaper hotel and spent time in transit. Beautiful 4 star facility. Lobby is lovely. Bathrooms are well appointed - think marble counters and lots of space. Highly recommended if your budget allows, or if it is a business travel expense.

Reviews.Title: “A great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Waterfront is perfectly located, close to downtown and Belltown. A great place to base yourselves for a family vacation (we were very happy with the deal we received booking a package through the marriott.com web site -- airfare, hotel and car rental.) Unlike many hotels, this one was very quiet. We stayed five nights and never heard the folks on either side of us. The waterfront view from our room (652) was very nice, and the small balcony was a plus. You are in easy walking distance to Pike Place Market and some wonderful restaurants in the Belltown neighborhood. A great find was La Bella e Vita on 2nd Avenue between Battery and Wall. Or just walk across the street to Pier 66 (we'd recommend you stick to the first floor, which they call the Bell Street Diner. An excellent menu, very fresh fish nicely prepared and if you like micro-brew beer, try the Manny's on tap. You can't get it in a bottle so enjoy it while you can. For breakfast, the Fish Club in the hotel offers a great buffet for a reasonable $14.95 per adult ($7.50 for children) or order off the menu (check out the French Toast). But most days we just walked up the adjacent stairway to the Pike Place Market and dropped into the Le Panier French bakery. There is also a great little donut spot at the south end of the market -- about $2 for a half dozen mini-donuts that you just watched them make. One caution: If you are staying for more than a couple nights and have a car, you might want to park it for $12 a day in the Art Institute parking garage to the north of the hotel. Turn right out of the hotel, go up a block to Wall, turn right on Wall, turn right at the next light and head up about a block to the garage's upper entrance. If you park on that level, you can walk through the garage and take an outside elevator down to Alaskan Way and you end up about a half block away from the hotel. A bargain compared to the $30 per night for valet parking at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing View”
Reviews.Author: etakathy
Reviews.Content: Our room at $219.00 per night was amazing, feather bedding, lots of pillows, starbucks coffee. Book the corner room #484, king bed, smoking, walk out only balcony. The views of Elliott Bay were breathtaking. Room service food was hot, however, they ran out of steaks on a Saturday night at 6pm. I will stay there again. Lobby was regal.

Reviews.Title: “Review by a manager in the service industry”
Reviews.Author: salesmgr
Reviews.Content: As a manager in the service industry, I felt compelled to share my review of this property. We stayed 1 night with guests from California. From the moment we entered the Lobby, this hotel far exceeded my expectations. I would recommend it, without hesitation, to anyone staying in the Seattle area. The service was above and beyond; the rooms inviting and very clean; the view, breathtaking!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joey965
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 nights at this hotel and it was great. With it's waterfront location, fabulous beds, and outstanding service, this year old hotel is a good choice. They have 2 concierge floos that give you access to a lounge that includes breakfast, afternoon snacks, beverages, and evening deserts. We were upgraded to this floor, upon asking, at no extra charge because we are Marriott Rewards members. A definite plus. Concierge was very helpful in planning activites and dinner reservations. Our favorite meal was right across the street at Anthony's on Pier 66. They brought us a complimentary appetizer and said it was from the concierge at the Marriott. Very impressive. Will defintiely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Bacrd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 1 night pre-cruise and it was great!! We had a 5th floor room overlooking the pool and a diagonal view of the water. NCL ships were parked directly across the street. Excellent location to the waterfront and Pike Place Market. Staff was friendly and accomodating. Bell boy even offered to push our luggage across to the pier...but we were leaving out of Pier 30. Excellent bathroom amenities. We managed an awesome government rate at this hotel...but even at full price, (atho pricey) I would stay here again!!! Previous posters complained of train noise...but we heard NOTHING!!! Great Place!

Reviews.Title: “Not again”
Reviews.Author: stew300
Reviews.Content: Beutiful in lobby and but a disapointing experience. It is adjacent to a two track frieght line that really spoiled our sleep time. I'm surprised other reviews did not mention it. We were in a concierge room for this! Very surprised at the concierge evening snacks: chicken wings and salami like meat with some celery sticks. Just too much fat for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to spend a night prior to a Cruise!”
Reviews.Author: Mozo
Reviews.Content: Although we spent only one night at the hotel we found the experience very pleasant. My wife and I arrived on Saturday 09/03 and spent the night before we departed Seattle on the Sapphire Princess to Alaska on Sunday 09/04. We found the hotel staff, hotel restaurant and our room to be excellent! Our room package came with a breakfast on Sunday and transfers to our cruise ship. You are literally across the street from the dock if you cruise with NCL or Celebrity. In our case we took the shuttle (part of our package) to the Holland America and Princess Cruise Line dock (about 5-10 minutes away). Much to our surprise the hotel is very close to Pike Market (what a place!)and downtown shopping. The friendly and polite hotel staff gave great directions and tips for our short excursions in Seattle. In closing, all we can say is that we would stay at this hotel again on our next visit to Seattle. In addition, consider Anthony's Restaurant (across the street) for some good seafood. Happy Travels to all!!!

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Waterfront- Mixed Reviews”
Reviews.Author: Kurt47
Reviews.Content: Positives... definitely location. Being on waterfront and near Pikes Market forinstance, beats being downtown at the Westin, Grand Hyatt, etc. where once you leave the hotel there's not much there. Negatives... as last poster said.. cold, impersonal.. just nothing special considering what it costs ($390 for our room on the Concierge level). Hotel looked like a hospital from outside--even drapes were green. Concierge lounge too small to accomodate all the 'elite members' fights for seats at breakfast. Question.. just what does it cost nowadays to get a really nice hotel/room. Used to be $300 was something.. now it's run of the mill.

Reviews.Title: “Waterfront Marriott disappoints”
Reviews.Author: Josie323
Reviews.Content: We like Marriott's in general but were disappointed with this one. Although it's on the water, this Marriott was cold and impersonal. We felt it was really geared toward the business traveler and expensive for what it offered. Breakfast in the restaurant was outrageously expensive and on one day, the maid didn't make up our room up at all! I'd try something different next time.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't know what to expect & was pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Shortz
Reviews.Content: I thought this was better than most JW Marriott Hotels. Good location--right on the water and near the Market and other great restaurants. Service was friendly and very helpful. Rooms were clean and up-to-date. This hotel is only 2 years old (found this out from the front desk) and it is clearly a demonstration of Marriott's efforts to be more competitive with the Westin hotels. I hope they upgrade their other hotels to this "new" standard.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But Noisy Air Conditioning”
Reviews.Author: JIMCHI
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over July 4th. Check-in was fast and pleasant. I had wanted a room with a direct waterfront view but the only one they had available had only 1 bed (there were 3 of us) and connected to another room (not a good idea I've found). We reserved a Concierge Level room and it was very nice. Almost all the rooms in the hotel have a partial water view. Our only complaint with the room was the noisy air conditioning. As it was warm in Seattle over the weekend, the air conditioning went on and off all night. There was a vibration and it kept us awake almost all night. In the end I don't think we would have wanted one of the direct waterfront rooms.
