There is an old streetcar which runs right in front of the hotel (like 10 feet from these rooms) and it rings its bell or blows its horn as it passes the hotel. It runs until very late at night. The Concierge Lounge was nicely stocked and the evening appetizers included hot and cold dishes. They also had a hot buffet in the Concierge Lounge in the morning, consisting of scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage as well as all the other stand buffet items. I am surprised by the earlier posting by some folks who also stayed there over the 4th of July. I know the General Manager was on duty as he came into the Concierge Lounge to greet everyone. "Oliver" may have thought he was "IT", but he wasn't. There was a fellow at the front desk who seemed to have an attitude, but I don't know if his name was Oliver. Other than the vibrating noise (which we reported on checkout), we had an enjoyable stay and would choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!! Great family hotel.”
Reviews.Author: danzie
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Marriott Waterfront. When we booked our room we choose to upgrade to the conciergers level which included a view of Elliotts Bay. I believe it was a $25 upgade. After we checked in our kids were diappointed our room didn't have a balcony. One call down to the lobby and we were easily moved to a different room with a balcony. The upgrade also included the conciergers lounge which was awesome. The four of us enjoyed a generous breakfast, which was more like a full breakfast, not continental which it had been listed. We had access throughout the day to a frig. stocked with water, milk and sodas. Starbucks coffee was also always avaliable. In the evening nice appetizers were put out and drinks could be purchased for a reasonable rate and to top it off fresh baked cookies were always out around 8:00. Our teenage boys were in heaven. The concierge was always in the lounge to help with any questions we might have and make necessary arrangements. Margo is who we worked with the most and we couldn't say enough good things about her. I'm sure our upgrade had a lot to do with our experience but the benefits far out weighed the cost. Breakfast alone would have cost at least $25 for a family of four. We also took advantage of the business center, which is avaliable to anyone. The hotel in general was very clean, nicely decorated and the location is great. Everyone we dealt with was extremely pleasant. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: TudsGirl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2-night stay at the Marriott Waterfront and likely will not return. We have stayed before and enjoyed the comfortable rooms and views, but this time we requested a room next to the pool to enjoy over the 4th of July holiday. As soon as we arrived and settled in, we went out to get in the pool and were shocked to see at least 3 young babies in the rather small pool, with diapers! We immediately called down to the front desk to ask their policy on this, and were told that someone would be up to our room to see us. Oliver, Front Desk Manager, arrived at our room saying they have no pool rules and that he saw nothing wrong with diapers in the pool. He was quite disagreeable and also said that whatever comes out of diapers is taken care of by chlorine, and that their paying guests were very important to them. We reminded him that we were also paying guests, to which he had no response. We asked to be able to speak to someone else, and he said he was IT. That was pretty much the end of the discussion. Needless to say, we had no desire to swim from then on and found the attitude disturbing, especially considering the potential health risks. We specifically chose to stay at this hotel for the holiday weekend for some sun, swimming and relaxing and left this hotel feeling no one even cared to hear our concerns or disappointment in not being able to use the pool. We are definitely not likely to return.

Reviews.Title: “I don't think I'd go back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In the lobby, this hotel may seem pretty elegant. Actually it isn't! My family and I had asked for a suite with two twins in one room and a king in the other. What we got was two kings. The mistake they made resulted with my young child sleeping with my wife, my teenager sleeping on the king and me sleeping on a pullout. It was extremely uncomfortable. Then when we had breakfast I found hair in my eggs. It was very unhygenic! I was discusted. From then on we ate out. I recommend this hotel if you're only staying for a couple days.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: MinnyTraveler
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Seattle Waterfront Marriott. The location is great, right along the water and very close to the market. I enjoyed taking walks/runs along the waterfront. The hotel itself is very pleasent and is nicely decorated. An added bonus is that the hotel has a business center where you can use their computers with unlimited completely free access to the internet. What a nice amenity to have when traveling! I had a great experience and would recommend this hotel to everyone!
